Umineko Project (UP): Gohda was doing the nighttime rounds.
Steam (ST): Gohda was doing the nighttime rounds.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は、夜の見回りをしていた。
Russian (RU): Года совершал ночной обход по особняку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda estava fazendo a ronda noturna.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鄉田正在巡夜。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 乡田正在巡夜。

Umineko Project (UP): There had never been anything on Rokkenjima outside the Ushiromiya family.{n}So checking that the doors and windows were all closed had no real purpose.
Steam (ST): Rokkenjima had always been empty, except for the Ushiromiya Family household. So, checking that the doors and windows were all closed had no real purpose.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): There had never been anything on Rokkenjima outside the Ushiromiya family. So checking that the doors and windows were all closed had no real purpose.
PC Japanese (JP): そもそも、六軒島には右代宮家以外は存在しない。だから戸締りやその確認には、それほど意味があるわけではない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そもそも、六軒島には右代宮家以外は存在しない。{n}だから戸締りやその確認には、それほど意味があるわけではない。
Russian (RU): На Роккенджиме, помимо семьи Уширомия, никто не проживал.{n}Поэтому в проверке того, заперты ли окна и двери, не было настоящего смысла.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nunca teve mais ninguém em Rokkenjima além da família Ushiromiya.{n}Logo, não havia um propósito real em conferir se todas as portas e janelas estavam fechadas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 按理說，六軒島上除去右代宮家就沒有別人了。{n}所以，鎖門和復查並沒有多大意義。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 按理说，六轩岛上除去右代宫家就没有别人了。{n}所以，锁门和复查并没有多大意义。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ever since Natsuhi had scolded them saying that this was careless, the nighttime rounds had become part of the servants' daily routine.
Steam (ST): However, ever since the time Natsuhi had condemned such an attitude as being careless, the nighttime rounds had become part of the servants' daily routine.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, since Natsuhi had scolded that this was careless, the nighttime rounds had become part of the servants' daily routine.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、夏妃がそれを無用心だと咎めて以来、夜回りは使用人たちの日課に組み込まれた。
Russian (RU): Но поскольку Нацухи ругалась, что не придавать значения окнам и дверям слишком беспечно, ночные обходы стали частью распорядка прислуги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, como Natsuhi sempre os repreendia, dizendo que isso era muito descaso, as rondas noturnas se tornaram parte da rotina dos serviçais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，自從夏妃斥責了“這樣太不小心了”後，巡夜就被加進了傭人們的每日工作表。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，自从夏妃斥责了“这样太不小心了”后，巡夜就被加进了佣人们的每日工作表。

Umineko Project (UP): ......The reason that Natsuhi had ordered this was the occasional disturbances of the witch.
Steam (ST): ...In the first place, Natsuhi had ordered this because of the occasional witch disturbances.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……そもそも、夏妃が夜回りを命じたのは、時折起こった、魔女騒動のせいだった。
Russian (RU): ......Причина, по которой Нацухи приказала так делать, заключалась в случающихся время от времени проказах ведьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......O motivo pelo qual Natsuhi ordenou isso é devido às ocasionais agitações sobre a bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……不過歸根結底，夏妃之所以會命令他們去巡夜，都是因為那時發生的魔女騷動。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……不过归根结底，夏妃之所以会命令他们去巡夜，都是因为那时发生的魔女骚动。

Umineko Project (UP): Everyone who visited this island knew about the legend of {f:5:Beatrice}, the witch of the forest. This had become established as this island's characteristic ghost story.
Steam (ST): Everyone who came and left this island knew about the legend of {f:5:Beatrice}, the witch of the forest. It had become established as this island's characteristic ghost story.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Everyone who came and left this island knew about the legend of Beatrice, the witch of the forest. This had become established as this island's characteristic ghost story.
PC Japanese (JP): この島に出入りする者なら誰もが知る、森の魔女ベアトリーチェの伝説。それはこの島独自の怪談として根付いていた。
Russian (RU): Прибывающие на остров и покидающие его люди знали легенду о {f:5:Беатриче} — ведьме из леса. Она стала историей про привидения, присущей этому острову.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Todos que visitam a ilha sabem sobre a lenda da bruxa da floresta, {f:5:Beatrice}. Isso se estabeleceu como uma história de fantasmas característica da ilha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 出入此島之人人盡皆知的，森林魔女貝阿朵莉切的傳說，是在這座島上扎下了根的，此地獨有的怪談。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 出入此岛之人人尽皆知的，森林魔女贝阿朵莉切的传说，是在这座岛上扎下了根的，此地独有的怪谈。

Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, it was only natural that some people would occasionally say that, when they thought they were alone in the mansion, ...they had heard strange sounds, or seen the shadow of a person.
Steam (ST): Because of that, it was only natural that some people would claim that, when they thought they were alone in the mansion, ...they would hear a strange sound or see the shadow of a person.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of that, it was only natural that some people would say that, when they thought they were alone in the mansion..., they would hear a strange sound or see the shadow of a person.
PC Japanese (JP): だから時折、誰もいないはずの屋敷内に、不気味な音や人影が…、というような話は、自然と起こったものだった。
Russian (RU): Поэтому не было ничего удивительного, что некоторые люди начинали рассказывать, как когда им казалось, что они были одни в особняке... Им слышался странный звук или они видели тень какого‐то человека.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, era natural que algumas pessoas ocasionalmente dissessem que, quando elas pensavam estar sozinhas na mansão, ...elas ouviam sons estranhos ou viam a sombra de uma pessoa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，偶爾會自然地冒出些，在大屋內理應無人之處，有令人毛骨悚然的聲音、人影之類的騷動的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，偶尔会自然地冒出些，在大屋内理应无人之处，有令人毛骨悚然的声音、人影之类的骚动的。

Umineko Project (UP): However, when that had created a little too big of a disturbance and reached Natsuhi's ears, she had made a fuss, thinking that some suspicious person might have been coming in and out.
Steam (ST): However, when that created a little too much of a disturbance and reached Natsuhi's ears, she made a fuss, thinking that some suspicious person might have been entering and leaving.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, when that had created a little too big of a disturbance and reached Natsuhi's ears, she had made a fuss, thinking that some suspicious person might have been entering and leaving.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それが少々騒ぎを大きくし過ぎて夏妃の耳にも届き、不審者が出入りしているのではないかと騒がれたのだ。
Russian (RU): Однако когда эти проказы достигли определённого уровня и дошли до ушей Нацухи, та подняла шум, полагая, что некая подозрительная личность заходила в особняк, а затем покидала его.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Porém, quando isto criou uma pequena, mais ainda assim grande, agitação e chegou aos ouvidos de Natsuhi, ela fez um rebuliço, pensando que alguma pessoa suspeita poderia estar indo e vindo a todo momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這稍微有點鬧得太大了，傳到了夏妃耳中，驚擾了她，使她疑心是不是有可疑之人在進出大屋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这稍微有点闹得太大了，传到了夏妃耳中，惊扰了她，使她疑心是不是有可疑之人在进出大屋。

Umineko Project (UP): Apparently, it was said that she had roused all of the servants and had them check throughout the mansion.
Steam (ST): Apparently, she had roused all the servants and had them check throughout the mansion.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Anyway, it was said that she had roused all of the servants and had them check throughout the mansion.
PC Japanese (JP): 何でも、使用人全員を叩き起こして、屋敷中を確認させるという大騒ぎもあったという。
Russian (RU): В общем, поговаривали, что она собрала всю прислугу и велела им прочесать особняк.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aparentemente, foi dito que ela acordou todos os serviçais e fez eles irem vasculhar a mansão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說，曾經甚至發生過她把所有傭人都叫醒，命令他們去搜查大屋的大亂子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据说，曾经甚至发生过她把所有佣人都叫醒，命令他们去搜查大屋的大乱子。

Umineko Project (UP): Because all of this uproar over the witch had happened before Gohda had come, he had only heard about it from the more senior servants.
Steam (ST): Because all of that panic over the witch had happened before Gohda's arrival, he had only heard about it from the more senior servants.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because all of this uproar over the witch had happened before Gohda had come, he had only heard about it from the more senior servants.
PC Japanese (JP): これらの魔女騒ぎについては、何れも郷田がやって来る前のことなので、郷田は古参の使用人たちから聞かされただけだ。
Russian (RU): Поскольку вся эта шумиха произошла до поступления Годы на службу, он слышал об этом лишь от слуг постарше.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa de todo o tumulto sobre a bruxa ter ocorrido antes de Gohda chegar, ele apenas ouviu isso dos serviçais mais experientes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這些關於魔女的騷動，全都發生在鄉田來這裡工作之前，所以鄉田只是從老一輩傭人口中聽說過而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这些关于魔女的骚动，全都发生在乡田来这里工作之前，所以乡田只是从老一辈佣人口中听说过而已。

Umineko Project (UP): Ghost stories like that could be found in any workplace. Even at the hotel Gohda had once worked at, and at the restaurant, there was never a shortage of those types of story.
Steam (ST): Ghost stories like that could be found in any workplace. Even at the hotels and restaurants Gohda had worked at, there had been plenty of them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Ghost stories like that could be found in any workplace. They hadn't even been lacking at the hotel or the restaurant Gohda had worked at.
PC Japanese (JP): この手の怪談はどこの職場にもある。かつて郷田が勤めていたホテルにだって、レストランにだって、その手の怪談は事欠かなかったものだ。
Russian (RU): Такие истории о привидениях можно услышать на любом месте работы. Их даже с лихвой хватало в отеле, в ресторане которого Года работал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Histórias de fantasmas como essas podem ser encontradas em qualquer lugar de trabalho. Mesmo no hotel que Gohda havia trabalhado, e também no restaurante, nunca faltou histórias desse tipo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這類怪談，是無論去哪裡工作都會碰見的。鄉田以前工作過的酒店、西餐廳，也都未曾少過此類怪談。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这类怪谈，是无论去哪里工作都会碰见的。乡田以前工作过的酒店、西餐厅，也都未曾少过此类怪谈。

Umineko Project (UP): So when he heard that story on this island, he smiled bitterly, thinking "ah, so they have that kind of thing here after all".
Steam (ST): So when he heard about that story on this island, he'd given a forced smile, thinking "Ah, so they have that kind of thing here after all".
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So when he had heard that story on this island, he had smiled bitterly, thinking 'ah, so they have that kind of thing here after all'.
PC Japanese (JP): だから、この島でその話を聞かされた時、あぁここにもやっぱりそういうものがあるんだなと苦笑したものだ。
Russian (RU): Так что когда он услышал историю на этом острове, он лишь едко улыбнулся, думая: "А‐а, и даже здесь такие вещи есть".
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, quando ele ouviu a história da ilha, Gohda sorriu amargamente, pensando "ah, então aqui também tem esse tipo de história?".
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，當他在這個島上聽到這個故事時，他想著“啊——這兒果然也有這些啊”，露出了苦笑。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，当他在这个岛上听到这个故事时，他想着“啊——这儿果然也有这些啊”，露出了苦笑。

Umineko Project (UP): He smiled bitterly, but he thought when in Rome, do as the Romans do, and had not slighted that.
Steam (ST): That forced smile aside, he had figured that, when in Rome, do as the Romans do, and had taken it seriously.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He had smiled bitterly, but he had thought when in Rome, do as the Romans do, and had not slighted that.
PC Japanese (JP): 苦笑はするが、それを蔑ろにしないのが、郷に入りては郷に従えというもの。
Russian (RU): Но, хоть улыбка его была и едка, он считал, что в чужой монастырь со своим уставом не лезут, и не стал относиться к этому небрежно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele sorriu amargamente, mas pensou que em Roma, deve se fazer como os romanos, e não desprezou isto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 苦笑歸苦笑，不去輕視這一點，即正是所謂的入鄉隨俗。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 苦笑归苦笑，不去轻视这一点，即正是所谓的入乡随俗。

Umineko Project (UP): Gohda went along with it on the outside, but in his heart he thought it was a childish trick. ......At first.
Steam (ST): Gohda went along with it on the outside, but in his heart, he'd assumed it to be a childish trick. ...At first, that is.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda went along with it on the outside, but in his heart he had thought it was a childish trick. ......At first.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田も上辺は合わせたが、内心は子供だましだと思っていたものだ。……最初は。
Russian (RU): Так Года внешне шёл у этого на поводу, но про себя считал эти истории детскими розыгрышами. ......Поначалу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda aparentava estar bem por fora, mas em seu coração ele pensava ser uma brincadeira infantil. ......No primeiro momento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，鄉田雖然表面上同意，但內心卻覺得，那只是騙小孩罷了。……剛開始是這麼想的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，乡田虽然表面上同意，但内心却觉得，那只是骗小孩罢了。……刚开始是这么想的。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "............This certainly is eerie. I see, I understand why the servants got in an uproar over this in the past."
Steam (ST): "......This certainly is eerie. Yes, I can see why it was so easy for past servants to get into a panic."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............This certainly is eerie. I see, I understand why servants got in an uproar over this in the past."
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………これは確かに不気味ですね。なるほど、過去の使用人たちが、色々と騒ぎたくなる気持ちもわかるものです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…………これは確かに不気味ですね。なるほど、過去の使用人たちが、色々と騒ぎたくなる気持ちもわかるものです」
Russian (RU): "............Да уж, определённо жутковато. Ясно, теперь я понимаю, почему слуги в прошлом устраивали из‐за этого гам."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Isso é realmente é agourento. Eu entendo o motivo dos serviçais terem feito um alvoroço sobre isso no passado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………這倒確實令人毛骨悚然呢。原來如此，咱也算是明白，以前傭人們這呀那呀地鬧起來的心情了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………这倒确实令人毛骨悚然呢。原来如此，咱也算是明白，以前佣人们这呀那呀地闹起来的心情了。」

Umineko Project (UP): He could understand that if someone, doing the rounds on an eerie night like this, saw a lace curtain waving in the breeze from a window which hadn't been closed, they might be tempted to believe they had seen a ghost.
Steam (ST): He could understand how someone doing the rounds on an eerie night like this... might believe they'd seen a ghost if they saw a lace curtain waving in the breeze from a window that hadn't been closed.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He could understand how someone doing the rounds on an eerie night like this might believe they had seen a ghost if they saw a lace curtain waving in the breeze from a window which hadn't been closed.
PC Japanese (JP): こんな不気味な夜の夜回りで、もしも閉め忘れた窓から入るそよ風がレースのカーテンを揺らしたなら、幽霊を見たと信じたくなる気持ちを充分に理解できた。
Russian (RU): Он мог понять, как кто‐то, совершая обход в эту жутковатую ночь и чувствуя, что ему не по себе, мог поверить, что увидел приведение, увидев кружевную занавеску, покачивающуюся из‐за проникающего через незапертое окно ветра.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele podia entender que se alguém, fazendo rondas noturnas em uma noite misteriosa como esta, visse uma cortina balançando com a brisa da janela que não havia sido fechada, ela poderia ser tentada a acreditar que tinha visto um fantasma.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在這樣陰森的夜晚巡夜，咱是充分理解，若是花邊窗簾被忘關的窗戶外吹進的微風搖動，就會以為自己看到幽靈了的感受了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在这样阴森的夜晚巡夜，咱是充分理解，若是花边窗帘被忘关的窗户外吹进的微风摇动，就会以为自己看到幽灵了的感受了。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "So there's a curse if you make fun of the witch of the portrait, huh. ......Seems like there were servants who got hurt really bad and quit, too. ...I'd hate to be injured. I'm already this old. Doubt I'll ever be blessed with a workplace this hospitable again... Aaah. Great witch of the portrait. I'm really gonna work hard here, so please go easy on me."
Steam (ST): "So, if you make fun of the witch of the portrait, there is a curse. ...It seems there was even a servant who received a serious injury and quit. ...Well, I wouldn't want that. Think of my age. I probably wouldn't be granted a workplace this hospitable again... Aaah. Witch of the portrait, I'm working sincerely, so please give me some peace."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "So, if you make fun of the witch of the portrait, there is a curse. ......It seems that there was even a servant who received a serious injury and quit. ...I'd hate to be injured. I am already this old. I probably wouldn't be granted a workplace this hospitable again... Aaah. Witch of the portrait. I'm working sincerely, so please give me some peace."
PC Japanese (JP): 「肖像画の魔女を馬鹿にすると、祟りがあるか。……大怪我をして辞めた使用人もいるらしいし。…怪我は勘弁だなぁ。俺もこの歳だ。二度とこんな厚遇の職場にゃ恵まれねぇだろうよ…。あー。肖像画の魔女さま。真面目に働きますんで、ひとつ穏便に頼みます。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「肖像画の魔女を馬鹿にすると、祟りがあるか。……大怪我をして辞めた使用人もいるらしいし。…怪我は勘弁だなぁ。俺もこの歳だ。二度とこんな厚遇の職場にゃ恵まれねぇだろうよ…。あー。肖像画の魔女さま。真面目に働きますんで、ひとつ穏便に頼みます」
Russian (RU): "Значит, если будешь насмехаться над ведьмой с портрета, то будешь проклят. ......Похоже, даже был слуга, получивший серьёзную травму и уволившийся. ...Не хотелось бы травмироваться. Я и так уже не молод. Мне вряд ли вновь удастся найти столь гостеприимное место работы, как эта... А‐а‐ах. Ведьма с портрета. Я искренне тружусь, так что дай мне немного покоя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Por isso há uma maldição para caso você deboche da bruxa do retrato? ......Parece que tem serviçais que se feriram gravemente e deixaram o trabalho também. ...Eu odiaria me machucar. Já tenho uma certa idade. Duvido que eu seja abençoado com tanta hospitalidade em outro local de trabalho... Aaah. Grande bruxa do retrato. Eu vou trabalhar muito duro aqui, então pegue leve comigo, por favor."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「小瞧肖像畫上的魔女，就會遭到作祟啊。……好像還有過受重傷辭職的傭人呢。…受傷可受不了。咱都這歲數了。恐怕再也沒機會碰上待遇這麼好的工作了…。啊——。肖像畫上的魔女夫人。鄙人有在認真工作，還請行個方便。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「小瞧肖像画上的魔女，就会遭到作祟啊。……好像还有过受重伤辞职的佣人呢。…受伤可受不了。咱都这岁数了。恐怕再也没机会碰上待遇这么好的工作了…。啊——。肖像画上的魔女夫人。鄙人有在认真工作，还请行个方便。」

Umineko Project (UP): Gohda prayed to the portrait, his hands together, as though he was at a Shinto shrine...
Steam (ST): Gohda prayed to the portrait, his hands together, as though he was at a Shinto shrine...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は神社でそうするように、肖像画に向かって手を合わせて拝む仕草をする…。
Russian (RU): Года помолился портрету, сложив ладони вместе, словно находился перед синтоистской святыней...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda orou em frente ao retrato, com suas mãos juntas, como se estivessem em um santuário xintoísta...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就像在神社裡那樣，鄉田雙手合一，向肖像畫拜了起來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就像在神社里那样，乡田双手合一，向肖像画拜了起来…。

Umineko Project (UP): At that time, ...he thought he heard a sound.
Steam (ST): At that time, ...he thought he heard a sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, ...he thought he heard a sound.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、…何か音が聞こえた気がした。
Russian (RU): И в этот момент... Ему показалось, что он услышал звук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, ...ele pensou ter ouvido um som.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此時，…感覺聽到了什麼聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此时，…感觉听到了什么声音。

Umineko Project (UP): The kitchen? Was that the sound of something metal falling on the floor?
Steam (ST): The kitchen? Was that the sound of something metal falling on the floor?
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The kitchen? Was that the sound of something metal falling on the floor?
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房？　金物か何かが床に落ちる音だったろうか。
Russian (RU): На кухне? Что‐то металлическое упало на пол?
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A cozinha? Teria sido o som de algum objeto de metal caindo sobre o piso?
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 廚房？是什麼金屬製物品掉到了地板上嗎？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 厨房？是什么金属制物品掉到了地板上吗？

Umineko Project (UP): Surely a mouse or a cockroach hadn't come out, and knocked over some of the dishes... No, no, how could that be. It was routinely and thoroughly cleaned!
Steam (ST): Maybe a mouse or a cockroach had come out and knocked over some of the dishes. No, no, how could that be? It was usually cleaned thoroughly!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Maybe a mouse or a cockroach had come out, and knocked over some of the dishes. No, no, how could that be. It was normally thoroughly cleaned!
PC Japanese (JP): まさかネズミかゴキブリでも出て、食器を落としたのだろうか。いやいやまさか。普段から清潔は徹底している！
Russian (RU): Должно быть, это вылезшая мышь или таракан опрокинул какое‐то из блюд. Нет, нет, как такое может быть. Её же обычно тщательно чистят!
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente um rato ou uma barata não apareceriam e derrubariam algum prato... Não, não poderia ser. Tudo era rotineiramente e completamente limpo!
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 難道是有老鼠、蟑螂，碰落了餐具？不不，怎麼會呢。平時的清潔都做得很徹底！
Chinese Simplified (CN): 难道是有老鼠、蟑螂，碰落了餐具？不不，怎么会呢。平时的清洁都做得很彻底！

Umineko Project (UP): Gohda thought that in any case he had better check what that noise had been, and entered the kitchen.
Steam (ST): Thinking he'd check out what that noise really had been, Gohda entered the kitchen.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Gohda thought he would check what that noise really had been and entered the kitchen.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田はとにかく音の正体を確かめようと厨房へ入った。
Russian (RU): Решив проверить, что же вызвало этот звук, Года зашёл на кухню.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gohda pensou que, de qualquer forma, era melhor ele ir conferir aquele barulho, e entrou na cozinha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為了確認到底是什麼聲音，鄉田進了廚房。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为了确认到底是什么声音，乡田进了厨房。

Umineko Project (UP): He turned on the kitchen light.{n}......When he did, he heard a strange sound.
Steam (ST): He turned on the kitchen light. When he did, he heard a strange sound.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He turned on the kitchen light. When he did, he heard a strange sound.
PC Japanese (JP): 厨房の明かりをつける。……すると不思議な音が聞こえた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 厨房の明かりをつける。{n}……すると不思議な音が聞こえた。
Russian (RU): Затем он включил свет.{n}Стоило ему это сделать, как он услышал странный звук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele ligou as luzes da cozinha.{n}......Quando as ligou, ouviu um som estranho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 開了廚房的燈。{n}……緊接著，就聽到了奇妙的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 开了厨房的灯。{n}……紧接着，就听到了奇妙的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): Clankclankclankclankclankclank.
Steam (ST): *clank*clank*clank*clank*clank*clank*.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): *clank*clank*clank*clank*clank*clank*.
PC Japanese (JP): カタカタカタカタカタカタ。
Russian (RU): *бряц*бряц*бряц*бряц*бряц*бряц*.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 咔噠咔噠咔噠咔噠咔噠咔噠。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 咔哒咔哒咔哒咔哒咔哒咔哒。

Umineko Project (UP): ......To a cook like Gohda, that sound seemed like the lid on the pressure cooker or something was shaking.
Steam (ST): ...To a cook like Gohda, the sound felt like the lid on a pressure cooker or something shaking.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……料理人である郷田は、その音が圧力鍋か何かが蓋を震わせる音のように感じた。
Russian (RU): ......Годе, будучи поваром, казалось, что это трясется крышка на скороварке или чём‐то подобном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Para um cozinheiro como Gohda, aquele som parecia vir da tampa em uma panela de pressão ou algo que estava tremendo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……身為廚師的鄉田覺得，這聲音應該是壓力鍋或別的什麼的蓋子震動時發出的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……身为厨师的乡田觉得，这声音应该是压力锅或别的什么的盖子震动时发出的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): Of course, it couldn't be in use when no one was in the kitchen.{n}If someone {i:had} been using the gas, what a dangerous thing to do, to just walk away from it.
Steam (ST): Surely, there wouldn't be a pot on the burner when no one was in the kitchen. Even if someone was using the gas, walking away from it would be quite dangerous.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Of course, it couldn't be in use when no one was in the kitchen. If someone was using the gas, walking away from it would be quite dangerous.
PC Japanese (JP): まさか、人のいない厨房で鍋をかけているわけもない。仮にガスを使っていたとして、その側を離れるなど、何と物騒な。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): まさか、人のいない厨房で鍋をかけているわけもない。{n}仮にガスを使っていたとして、その側を離れるなど、何と物騒な。
Russian (RU): Но, разумеется, так как на кухне никого не было, то некому было воспользоваться ей.{n}Если кто‐то пользовался газом, то покинуть кухню было бы опасным поступком.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): É claro, não estaria em uso quando não houvesse ninguém na cozinha.{n}Se alguém {i:estivesse} usando o fogão, o que seria algo perigoso a se fazer, seria melhor não se aproximar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 沒人的廚房，怎麼可能會有鍋在煮東西。{n}就算有人用了煤氣，那人不好好看著，也實在太危險了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 没人的厨房，怎么可能会有锅在煮东西。{n}就算有人用了煤气，那人不好好看着，也实在太危险了。

Umineko Project (UP): ...Just in case, Gohda decided to inspect the area around the gas range...
Steam (ST): ...Just in case, Gohda decided to inspect the area around the gas range...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …郷田は念のため、ガス台の回りを点検することにする…。
Russian (RU): ...На всякий случай Года решил проверить область вокруг газовых плит...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Em todo caso, Gohda decidiu inspecionar as bocas do fogão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …為了以防萬一，鄉田檢查了一遍煤氣灶…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …为了以防万一，乡田检查了一遍煤气灶…。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Steam (ST): "......What is this...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……………何ですか、これは…。」

Umineko Project (UP): When he did, in the corner by the gas range, ...the pressure cooker really had been placed there, just as he had thought.
Steam (ST): When he did, in the corner with the gas range, ...the pressure cooker really had been set out, just as he'd thought.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he did, in the corner by the gas range, ...the pressure cooker really had been set, just as he had thought.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、ガス台の脇に、…確かに想像の通りに圧力鍋が置かれていた。
Russian (RU): Совершая эту проверку, он увидел, как в углу газовой плиты действительно установлена скороварка, как он и предполагал.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fazer isto, em uma das bocas, ...estava uma panela de pressão, assim como ele havia imaginado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在煤氣灶的邊上，…確實如他所想，擺著個壓力鍋。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在煤气灶的边上，…确实如他所想，摆着个压力锅。

Umineko Project (UP): But the flame wasn't on.{n}...And yet, the lid was clanking...
Steam (ST): But the flame wasn't on. ...And yet, the lid was clanking...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But the flame wasn't on....And yet, the lid was clanking...
PC Japanese (JP): しかしそれは火をかけられてはいない。…にもかかわらず、蓋をカタカタ言わせている…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかしそれは火をかけられてはいない。{n}…にもかかわらず、蓋をカタカタ言わせている…。
Russian (RU): Вот только газ не был зажжен.{n}...А крышка всё‐таки бряцала...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas não havia nenhuma chama acessa.{n}...E mesmo assim, a tampa estava batendo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 可是，沒有開火。{n}…可儘管如此，蓋子卻在咔噠咔噠地響…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 可是，没有开火。{n}…可尽管如此，盖子却在咔哒咔哒地响…。

Umineko Project (UP): Was something fermenting and leaking gas?{n}...How could that be? ......Then was there a mouse or something inside?{n}...How could there be, ridiculous...
Steam (ST): Was something fermenting and leaking gas? ...How could that be? ...Then was there a mouse or something inside? ...How could there be? Ridiculous...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Was something fermenting and leaking gas?...How could it be? ......Then is there a mouse or something inside?...How could there be, ridiculous...
PC Japanese (JP): 何かが発酵してガスでも出している？…まさか。……じゃあネズミでも入ってるとか？…まさか、馬鹿馬鹿しい…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 何かが発酵してガスでも出している？{n}…まさか。……じゃあネズミでも入ってるとか？{n}…まさか、馬鹿馬鹿しい…。
Russian (RU): Неужели что‐то гнило, источая газ?{n}...Как такое может быть? ......Там мышь внутри, что ли?{n}...Но откуда? Что за вздор...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Seria algo fermentando e deixando o vapor vazar?{n}...Como isso poderia acontecer? ......Então deveria ser um rato ou alguma coisa que estava dentro?{n}...Como isso pode estar acontecendo, que ridículo...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 是鍋裡有什麼發酵了，釋放出了氣體？{n}…怎麼會呢。……那麼，是有老鼠鑽進去了？{n}…怎麼會呢，這也太荒唐了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 是锅里有什么发酵了，释放出了气体？{n}…怎么会呢。……那么，是有老鼠钻进去了？{n}…怎么会呢，这也太荒唐了…。

Umineko Project (UP): In front of people, Gohda acted as though he had a bold personality fitting for his build, ......but he actually had an unexpectedly timid side to him.
Steam (ST): When people were watching, Gohda acted as though he had a bold personality fitting for his build, ...but he actually had an unexpectedly timid side to him.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In front of people, Gohda acted as though he had a bold personality fitting for his build, ......but he actually had an unexpectedly timid side to him.
PC Japanese (JP): 郷田は、人前では体格どおりの豪胆そうな性格を装っているが、……実際は、案外臆病な一面も持っていた。
Russian (RU): Перед другими людьми Года отыгрывал типаж смелого человека, чтобы соответствовать своему телосложению, но на деле, что могло показаться неожиданным, ему была присуща и боязливость.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em frente as pessoas, Gohda age como se tivesse uma personalidade robusta para combinar com sua aparência, ......mas ele inesperadamente possui um lado mais tímido.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然鄉田在別人面前裝著副與體格相稱的勇敢的樣子，……但其實，他還有著令人意外的，膽小的一面。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然乡田在别人面前装着副与体格相称的勇敢的样子，……但其实，他还有着令人意外的，胆小的一面。

Umineko Project (UP): He was terrified to find out what might be inside, and he couldn't check it carelessly...
Steam (ST): He was frightened that there might be something inside, and he couldn't bring himself to check it carelessly...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He was frightened that there might be something inside, and he couldn't check it carelessly...
PC Japanese (JP): その中に何が入っているのか、恐ろしくて、迂闊に確かめられない…。
Russian (RU): Его пугала мысль о том, что там внутри может что‐то находиться, поэтому он не мог отнестись к проверке беззаботно...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele estava apavorado para descobrir o que poderia estar dentro, e não poderia checar de maneira descuidada...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 怕得不敢大大咧咧地直接打開蓋子，看看裡面有什麼…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 怕得不敢大大咧咧地直接打开盖子，看看里面有什么…。

Umineko Project (UP): In his cowardice, ...he grabbed a nearby wooden pestle, and with a {i:clunk!}, he tapped it a little strongly against the side of the pressure cooker.
Steam (ST): In his cowardice, ...he grabbed a nearby wooden pestle, and with a *clunk!* he tapped it a little forcefully against the side of the pressure cooker.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In his cowardice, ...he grabbed a nearby wooden pestle, and with a *clunk!* he tapped it a little strongly against the side of the pressure cooker.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼は臆病にも、…近くのすりこぎを取り、それで圧力鍋の側面を、コン！と少し強く叩いてみた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 彼は臆病にも、…近くのすりこぎを取り、それで圧力鍋の側面を、コン！　と少し強く叩いてみた。
Russian (RU): Труся, он схватил лежащий поблизости деревянный пестик и {i:лязг}, вложив немного силы в удар, стукнул скороварку в бок..
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com toda a sua covardice, ...ele pegou um pilão de madeira que estava próximo, e com um {i:clunk!}, ele bateu com um pouco de força na lateral da panela de pressão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 即便是膽小的他，…也還是拿起了近處的研杵，對著壓力鍋的側面，咚！地一聲，略微用力地敲了一下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 即便是胆小的他，…也还是拿起了近处的研杵，对着压力锅的侧面，咚！地一声，略微用力地敲了一下。

Umineko Project (UP): When he did, the clanking sound suddenly stopped.
Steam (ST): When he did, the clanking sound suddenly stopped.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When he did, the clanking sound suddenly stopped.
PC Japanese (JP): すると、カタカタ言わせていた音はぴたりと止まる。
Russian (RU): Стоило ему это сделать, как лязгающий звук внезапно прекратился.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando bateu, o som que tinia parou de repente.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 隨著那一敲，咔噠咔噠之聲戛然而止。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 随着那一敲，咔哒咔哒之声戛然而止。

Umineko Project (UP): ...He should have been relieved now that it had stopped, ...but the fact that it had stopped when he had hit it was even more eerie, and made him even more suspicious about what was inside...
Steam (ST): ...He should've been relieved that it had stopped, ...but the fact that it had stopped when he'd hit it was even more eerie, and made him even more suspicious about what was inside...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …止まって安心のはずなのだが、…叩いたら止めた、という点がかえって不気味で、その中身の正体をさらに疑わせた…。
Russian (RU): ...На этом ему бы и следовало успокоиться, но так как звук прекратился после его удара, это лишь добавило жути происходящему, только усилив его подозрения насчёт того, что могло прятаться внутри...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Ele deve ter ficado aliviado que havia parado, ...mas o fato de ter parado quando ele bateu deixou tudo ainda mais misterioso, e o deixou com ainda mais dúvidas sobre o que estava dentro...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …不再出聲本應令人安心，…但是，一敲就沒聲了這一點反而令人心裡發毛，更加懷疑裡面到底有什麼了…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …不再出声本应令人安心，…但是，一敲就没声了这一点反而令人心里发毛，更加怀疑里面到底有什么了…。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "............nn, ...*gulp*. .........Strange phenomena do not exist in this world, no sirree. Yes, there's no such thing as witches, or magic, things like that can't possibly exist. All phenomena can be explained with science. ......As though monsters and witches could exist...!"
Steam (ST): "......Hmm, ...*gulp*. ......Mysterious phenomena do not exist in this world. Yes, witches and magic, things like that couldn't possibly exist. All phenomena can be explained with science. ...As if monsters and witches could exist...!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "............Hmm, ...*gulp*. .........Strange phenomena do not exist in this world. Yes, witches and magic, things like that couldn't exist. All phenomena can be explained with science. ......As though monsters and witches could exist...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「…………ん、…ごくり。………この世に、怪奇現象なんて存在しませんとも。えぇ、そんな魔女も魔法も、そんなもの存在するわけがない。全ての現象は科学的に説明できるんです。……オバケも魔女もいてたまるもんですか…！」
Russian (RU): "............Хм‐м...*глыг*. .........Странных явлений не существует в этом мире. Да, ведьмы, магия и тому подобное не существуют. Все такие явления можно объяснить с научной точки зрения. ......Чтобы чудовища и ведьмы существовали, ага, как же!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "............Hmm, ...*gulp*. .........Fenômenos paranormais não existem neste mundo, não mesmo. Sim, não existem coisas como bruxas, ou magia, coisas que não podem existir de verdade. Todos os fenômenos podem ser explicados pela ciência. ......Como se monstros e bruxas pudessem existir...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…………嗯，…咕嚕。………在這個世上，根本不存在什麼怪奇現象。沒錯，魔女也好魔法也好，都是不存在的。所有的現象都能以科學作出解釋。……才不會有妖怪與魔女呢…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…………嗯，…咕噜。………在这个世上，根本不存在什么怪奇现象。没错，魔女也好魔法也好，都是不存在的。所有的现象都能以科学作出解释。……才不会有妖怪与魔女呢…！」

Umineko Project (UP): He repeated that many times, trying to build up his own confidence. ...It was quite comical how he looked completely different from what he was saying.
Steam (ST): He repeated that many times, trying to build up his own confidence. ...The gap between what he was saying and what he was doing was quite comical.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): He repeated that many times, trying to build up his own confidence....It was quite comical how he looked completely different from what he was saying.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分を勇気付けるように何度もそれを繰り返す。…その言葉の意味するところと逆に見えるのが、何とも滑稽だった。
Russian (RU): Он много раз повторил это, пытаясь обрести уверенность. ...Со стороны было комично наблюдать, как разнятся его вид и сказанные им слова.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ele repetiu isso diversas vezes, tentando reaver sua própria confiança.{n}...Era ligeiramente cômico em como ele parecia completamente diferente do que dizia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 為了使自己鼓起勇氣，鄉田重複了好幾遍這句話。…不過，這句話的句意卻與他的神情完全相反，顯得很是滑稽。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 为了使自己鼓起勇气，乡田重复了好几遍这句话。…不过，这句话的句意却与他的神情完全相反，显得很是滑稽。

Speaker: Gohda Toshiro
Umineko Project (UP): "Who would believe in a witch, who would believe in magic or curses... ......Come on, ......show me what you really are...! Take that!"
Steam (ST): "Who would believe in a witch, who would believe in magic or curses...? ...Come on, ...show me what you really are...! Take that!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Who would believe in a witch, who would believe in magic or curses.........Come on, ......show me what you really are...! Take that!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「何が魔女だ、何が魔法だ祟りだ…。……そら、……正体を見せてみろ…！っそりゃ！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「何が魔女だ、何が魔法だ祟りだ…。……そら、……正体を見せてみろ…！　っそりゃ！」
Russian (RU): "Да кто поверит в ведьму, магию и проклятья... ......Давай, покажи мне, кем или чем являешься на самом деле! Получай!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como pode se acreditar em bruxas, como se pode acreditar em magia ou maldições...?! ......Vamos, ......me mostre o que você realmente é...! Toma isso!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「什麼魔女啊，什麼魔法、作祟啊…。……來，……讓咱看看你的真面目…！呵呀！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「什么魔女啊，什么魔法、作祟啊…。……来，……让咱看看你的真面目…！呵呀！」

Umineko Project (UP): ......He removed the lid of the pressure cooker.
Steam (ST): ...He removed the lid of the pressure cooker.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...He removed the lid of the pressure cooker.
PC Japanese (JP): 圧力鍋の蓋を、……取り払う。

Russian (RU): ...На её же месте встала другая Золотая Ведьма... Та, что в прошлом объяснила {f:5:Беатриче} путь Ведьмы Бесконечности, единственная личность, которую {f:5:Беатриче} за всю свою жизнь называла наставницей.

Umineko Project (UP): No, this looked like a completely different person than Kumasawa.

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}

Steam (ST): "......Well, well, Teacher. I never even dreamed that we would meet each other again."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Well, well, Teacher. I never even dreamed the day would come that we would meet each other again."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………これはこれはお師匠様。再びお会いできる日が訪れるとは、夢にも思いませんでした。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………これはこれはお師匠様。再びお会いできる日が訪れるとは、夢にも思いませんでした」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "V‐...Você... Quem é você? Por que a Kumasawa baa‐chan se transformou em uma moça tão bonita assim?! Digo, quem é você?! Eu que não entendi?! Que tipo de efeitos especiais são esses?! Parece que minha cabeça vai explodir!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「你、…你是…，什麼人啊？熊澤婆婆怎麼會變成這副模樣的阿姐？！話說回來，你誰啊？！莫名其妙！！這是啥特殊效果啊？！我的腦袋都亂得，不知道要變成咋樣了！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「你、…你是…，什么人啊？熊泽婆婆怎么会变成这副模样的阿姐？！话说回来，你谁啊？！莫名其妙！！这是啥特殊效果啊？！我的脑袋都乱得，不知道要变成咋样了！！」

Umineko Project (UP): "I am the witch master of that child. My old name was {f:5:Beatrice}. When she succeeded me, I gave her that name, so I do not have a name."
Steam (ST): "I am the witch teacher of that child. My old name was {f:5:Beatrice}. When that child succeeded me, I gave up that name, so I have no name of my own."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I am the witch teacher of that child. My old name was Beatrice. When that child succeeded me, I gave her that name, so I do not have a name."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私は、あの子の魔女の師匠です。かつての名はベアトリーチェ。あの子が私を継ぐ時に、その名を贈った為、今は名を持ちません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私は、あの子の魔女の師匠です。かつての名はベアトリーチェ。あの子が私を継ぐ時に、その名を贈った為、今は名を持ちません」
Russian (RU): "Я ведьма‐наставница этого дитя. Моё прежнее имя было {f:5:Беатриче}. Когда это дитя стало моей преемницей, я отдала ей это имя и теперь безымянная."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu sou a bruxa que foi professora daquela criança. Meu antigo nome é {f:5:Beatrice}. Quando ela me sucedeu, passei a ela meu nome, por isso eu não tenho um nome."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我是那孩子的魔女師傅。以前的名字叫貝阿朵莉切。由於在那孩子接我班時贈予了此名，所以現在沒有名字。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我是那孩子的魔女师傅。以前的名字叫贝阿朵莉切。由于在那孩子接我班时赠予了此名，所以现在没有名字。」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "You already said it, but your disciple's being a real pain to me! Please, take responsibility and do something! No, wait!!"
Steam (ST): "Like you've already said, your disciple's been a real pain to me! Please, take responsibility and do something! No, wait!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "You already said it, but your disciple's been a real pain to me! Please, take responsibility and do something! No, wait!!
PC Japanese (JP): 「あんたがすでに言い切っちまってるが、俺はあんたの弟子のせいで大いに迷惑しているぜ！　頼むから責任取って何とかしてくれッ！　じゃなくてッ！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あんたがすでに言い切っちまってるが、俺はあんたの弟子のせいで大いに迷惑しているぜ！　頼むから責任取って何とかしてくれッ！　じゃなくてッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Это ты уже сказала, но твоя ученица оказалась ещё той занозой в пятой точке! Прошу, прими ответственность и сделай что‐нибудь! Нет, стой!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você já disse isso, mas sua discípula vem sendo mesmo um problema para mim! Por favor, assuma a responsabilidade e faça algo a respeito! Não, espera!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「雖然你已經說過了，但我再說一次，我可是因為你的徒弟倒大霉了！拜託了，負起責任想辦法幫幫忙吧！不對不對！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「虽然你已经说过了，但我再说一次，我可是因为你的徒弟倒大霉了！拜托了，负起责任想办法帮帮忙吧！不对不对！！」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Battler
Umineko Project (UP): "I don't believe in stuff like this!! As if witches and magic are real!! I won't accept this messed‐up battle! Damn it all to hell, what am I supposed to believe?!!"
Steam (ST): "I don't believe in stuff like this!! As if witches and magic could exist!! I won't accept this messed-up battle! Dammit, what should I believe?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't believe in stuff like this!! As if witches and magic could exist!! I won't accept this messed-up battle! You bastard, what should I believe?!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 俺はこんなの信じねぇぞ！！　魔女も魔法もあるもんか！！　こんな滅茶苦茶バトル、俺は認めねぇぞ！　くそったれ、俺は何を信じりゃいいんだ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「俺はこんなの信じねぇぞ！！　魔女も魔法もあるもんか！！　こんな滅茶苦茶バトル、俺は認めねぇぞ！　くそったれ、俺は何を信じりゃいいんだ！！」
Russian (RU): "Я не верю в такие вещи! Ведьмы и магия существуют, ну да, как же! Я не приму этот долбанный бой! Дрянь, чему мне верить?!!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu não acredito em coisas assim!! Como se bruxas e magia fossem reais!! Eu não aceito essa batalha absurda! Puta merda, no que eu deveria acreditar?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我才不信這種玩意呢！！哪會有魔女與魔法啊！！這樣胡來的戰鬥，我是不會承認的！王八蛋，我該信什麼好啊！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我才不信这种玩意呢！！哪会有魔女与魔法啊！！这样胡来的战斗，我是不会承认的！王八蛋，我该信什么好啊！！」

Umineko Project (UP): "Hoh‐hoh‐ho... Just like you, hospitality with a very quick temper."
Steam (ST): "Hohohoh... That's just like you, hospitality with a very quick temper."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hoh-hoh-ho... Just like you, hospitality with a very quick temper."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ほっほっほ…。あなたらしい、とても短気な持て成しですね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ほっほっほ…。あなたらしい、とても短気なもてなしですね」
Russian (RU): "Хо‐хо‐хо... Ты в своём репертуаре — гостеприимна, но быстро вспыхиваешь."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hoh‐hoh‐ho... Típico de você, com esse temperamento curto quanto à hospitalidade."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「嚯嚯嚯…。確實是如你風格，頗為性急的款待呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「嚯嚯嚯…。确实是如你风格，颇为性急的款待呢。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "...*cackle*cackle*. I'd expect nothing less from you, Master. It looks like this level of magic is so insignificant to you, you can't even be bothered to open your eyes...!"
Steam (ST): "...*cackle*cackle* I'd expect nothing less from you, Teacher. It seems this is so trivial to you, you don't even feel like opening your eyes...!
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "...*cackle*cackle*. I'd expect nothing less from you, Teacher. It looks like you ridiculously don't feel like opening your eyes even at this level...!
PC Japanese (JP): 「…くっくっくっく。さすがお師匠様。この程度じゃ、馬鹿馬鹿しくて瞼を開く気にもならないらしい…！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「…くっくっくっく。さすがお師匠様。この程度じゃ、馬鹿馬鹿しくて瞼を開く気にもならないらしい…！」
Russian (RU): "...*хи‐хи*хи‐хи*. Меньшего от вас и не ожидала, наставница. Я смотрю, вы упорно не собираетесь открывать глаза даже когда вокруг вас разворачиваются такие события!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "...*gargalhada*gargalhada*. Eu não espero menos de você, professora. Parece que o este nível de magia é tão insignificante para você, que sequer se incomodou em abrir seus olhos...!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「…呵呵呵呵。不愧是師傅大人。看來，就這程度，是無聊地連眼睛都懶得睜開呢…！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「…呵呵呵呵。不愧是师傅大人。看来，就这程度，是无聊地连眼睛都懒得睁开呢…！」

Umineko Project (UP): "Looks like it'll be impossible unless I'm prepared to wreck the whole island, riiiiiight? Come, arise, Shoulder War Towers!!"

Umineko Project (UP): In response to {f:5:Beatrice}'s summons, a terrific earth tremor split the rose garden.
Steam (ST): In response to {f:5:Beatrice}'s summons, a terrific earth tremor split the rose garden.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In response to Beatrice's summons, a terrific earth tremor split the rose garden.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェの呼びかけに応え、凄まじい地響きと共に薔薇庭園が裂ける。
Russian (RU): В ответ на призыв {f:5:Беатриче}, началось сильное землетрясение, расколовшее розарий надвое.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em resposta às invocações de {f:5:Beatrice}, um terrível tremor de terra dividiu o jardim de rosas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 應貝阿朵莉切的呼喚，隨著轟轟巨響，玫瑰庭園的地面裂開來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 应贝阿朵莉切的呼唤，随着轰轰巨响，玫瑰庭园的地面裂开来了。

Umineko Project (UP): And on either side of her shoulders, two massive War Towers sprouted and stabbed into the heavens. They stretched 100 {c:86Ef9C:merute} tall, and each one had over 360 ports.
Steam (ST): And on either side of her shoulders, two massive War Towers sprouted and stabbed into the heavens. They stretched up to 100 {c:86Ef9C:merute} tall, and each had over 360 ports.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And on either side of her shoulders, two massive War Towers sprouted and stabbed into the heavens. They stretched up to 100 {c:86EF9C:merute} tall, and each one had over 360 ports.
PC Japanese (JP): そして彼女の双肩を挟むように、天を突く二基の巨大な戦塔が生える。その高さは１００メルテにも及び、銃眼の数は片方だけで３６０を越える。
Russian (RU): И над каждым её плечом в небо вознесли и уткнулись две массивные боевые башни. Высота их составляла около 100 {c:86ef9c:мерутов} и на каждой насчитывалось примерно 360 окон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E em cada lado de seus ombros, duas massivas Torres de Guerra brotaram e perfuraram os céus. Elas se esticaram a uma altura de 100 {c:86Ef9C:merute}, cada uma com mais de 360 embrasuras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 然後，像是夾著她的雙肩似的，長出了兩座直插天空的巨大戰塔。其高度達到了一百{c:86EF9C:梅爾泰}，槍眼數量光是一座就超過了三百六十。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書同名條目）}
Chinese Simplified (CN): 然后，像是夹着她的双肩似的，长出了两座直插天空的巨大战塔。其高度达到了一百{c:86EF9C:梅尔泰}，枪眼数量光是一座就超过了三百六十。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书同名条目）}

Umineko Project (UP): They were War Towers of the gods' army corps, which had not allowed the heroes of antiquity to invade their precincts, even as they banded together.
Steam (ST): They were War Towers of the gods' army corps, which had prevented even groups of ancient heroes from invading their sacred grounds.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were War Towers of the gods' army corps, which hadn't allowed even groups of ancient heroes to invade their precincts.
PC Japanese (JP): それこそが、古代英雄たちが束になっても神域を侵すことを許さなかった、神々の兵団の戦塔。
Russian (RU): Это были боевые башни армейского корпуса богов, не позволявшие даже древним героям вторгаться в их владения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Elas eram Torres de Guerra dos membros de batalha dos deuses, que não permitiram que os heróis da antiguidade invadissem seus recintos sagrados, mesmo atacando juntos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這即正是古代英雄們即便團結一致，也無法越過其侵犯神域的，諸神兵團的戰塔。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这即正是古代英雄们即便团结一致，也无法越过其侵犯神域的，诸神兵团的战塔。

Umineko Project (UP): As {f:5:Beatrice} elegantly floated in the gap between the massive two‐headed towers, she looked down on her master, sneering with an absolute superiority.
Steam (ST): As {f:5:Beatrice} elegantly floated in the gap between the massive two-headed towers, she looked down on her teacher, sneering with a sense of absolute superiority.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As Beatrice elegantly floated in the gap between the massive two-headed towers, she looked down on her teacher, sneering with an absolute superiority.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェはその巨大な双頭の塔の狭間に優雅に浮かびながら、師匠を見下ろし、絶対の優位に嘲笑う。
Russian (RU): Элегантно паря в проеме между этими массивными башнями, {f:5:Беатриче} смотрела вниз на свою наставницу, ухмыляясь с чувством превосходства.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} elegantemente flutuava no vazio entre as duas torres de duas cabeças, olhando para sua professora que estava no chão, zombando dela com absoluta superioridade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切在這巨大的雙頭塔之間優雅地漂浮著，俯視師傅，以絕對優勢嘲笑著她。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切在这巨大的双头塔之间优雅地漂浮着，俯视师傅，以绝对优势嘲笑着她。

Umineko Project (UP): With the two massive towers lined up behind her shoulders, the witch looked very small, like a butterfly dancing between large trees.
Steam (ST): With the two massive towers lined up behind her shoulders, the witch looked very small, like a butterfly dancing between huge trees.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With the two massive towers lined up behind her shoulders, the witch looked very small, like a butterfly dancing through a large tree.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨大なる塔を双肩に並べる魔女はあまりに小さく見え、まるで大樹の間を舞う蝶のように見えた。
Russian (RU): На фоне возвышающихся за её плечами башен ведьма казалась очень маленькой, словно бабочка, порхающая между деревьями.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com as duas massivas torres alinhadas atrás de seus ombros, a bruxa parecia muito pequena, como uma borboleta dançando entre grandes árvores.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 與雙肩巨大的戰塔並排，使魔女看起來變得非常小，宛如在大樹間飛舞的蝴蝶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 与双肩巨大的战塔并排，使魔女看起来变得非常小，宛如在大树间飞舞的蝴蝶。

Umineko Project (UP): "Hihhyahhyahhyaaaaaa!! Don't think you can dodge it by turning into butterflies, alright? The density of the twin towers' barrage wouldn't just make you a pinned bug collection, it'd make you a madly stabbed pincushion, get it...?"
Steam (ST): "Hihhyahhyahhyaaaaaa!! Don't think you can dodge it by turning into butterflies, okay? The density of the twin towers' barrage wouldn't just make you a pinned bug sample, it'd make you a madly stabbed pincushion, right...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hihhyahhyahhyaaaaaa!! Don't think you can dodge it by turning into butterflies, alright? The density of the twin towers' barrage wouldn't just make you a pinned bug collection, it'd make you a madly stabbed pincushion, right...?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ひっひゃっひゃっひゃあああぁ！！　蝶に化ければかわせるとか思うなよぉ？　双子塔の弾幕密度じゃあんた、虫ピンの昆虫標本どころか、滅多刺しの針刺し人形だぜェ…？」
