PC Japanese (JP): 一斉に放たれる軽く千を超えるバリスタ弾が、美しい幾何学模様で死のカーテンを描く。
Russian (RU): Выстрелы больше тысячи баллист произошли одновременно, рисуя красивую геометрическую кривую смерти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As balistas dispararam facilmente mais de mil vezes de uma só vez, traçando uma linda e geométrica cortina mortal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一齊放出的超過千支的巨型弩箭，以美麗的幾何學圖案描繪出了死之瀑簾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一齐放出的超过千支的巨型弩箭，以美丽的几何学图案描绘出了死之瀑帘。

Umineko Project (UP): The boorish sound performed by those bowstrings was probably even deeper than the sound of Death swinging his scythe.
Steam (ST): The boorish sound as the bowstrings were played was probably even deeper than that of a reaper swinging its sickle.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The boorish sound as the bowstrings were played was probably even deeper than the sound of a death god swinging its sickle.
PC Japanese (JP): それらの弦が奏でる無骨な音は、多分、死神が鎌を振るうその音よりも、重い。
Russian (RU): Грубый звук спущенной тетивы был даже глубже, чем замах косы мрачного жнеца.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O rústico som performado por aquelas cordas de aço certamente era ainda mais profundo que o som da Morte balançando sua foice.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以各自弩弦演奏出的粗俗之聲，多半比死神揮下鐮刀的聲音還要沉重。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以各自弩弦演奏出的粗俗之声，多半比死神挥下镰刀的声音还要沉重。

Umineko Project (UP): "Come, arise, Fallen Tower. Split the single language, and make known the sin."
Steam (ST): "Come, arise, Fallen Tower. Split the single language and let that sin be known."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「さぁさお出でなさい、墜落せし塔よ。一なる言語を爆ぜ、その罪を知らしめよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さぁさお出でなさい、墜落せし塔よ。一なる言語を爆ぜ、その罪を知らしめよ」
Russian (RU): "Явитесь, восстаньте, Падшие башни. Разделите единый язык и сделайте грех известным."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos, venham, Torres Caídas. Dividam o único vernáculo e façam‐a conhecer o pecado."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「來——來，出來吧，墜落之塔。炸散唯一的語言，通告其罪。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「来——来，出来吧，坠落之塔。炸散唯一的语言，通告其罪。」

Umineko Project (UP): The sky was stained an incandescent red, and from between the clouds, a blazing, massive tower fell upside down.
Steam (ST): The sky was stained an incandescent red, and from between the clouds, a blazing, massive tower fell upside down.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 空は灼熱の赤に染まり、雲間から燃え盛る巨大な塔が真っ逆さまにり落ちる。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 空は灼熱の赤に染まり、雲間から燃え盛る巨大な塔が真っ逆さまに降り落ちる。
Russian (RU): Небо залило раскалённой краснотой и из облаков вниз головой упала массивная сверкающая башня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O firmamento foi manchado por um vermelho incandescente e, entre as nuvens, uma resplandecente e massiva torre caiu do céu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 天空被染成灼熱的赤紅，從雲間上下顛倒地降下了熊熊燃燒著的巨大的塔。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 天空被染成灼热的赤红，从云间上下颠倒地降下了熊熊燃烧着的巨大的塔。

Umineko Project (UP): That massive falling tower and its rubble...swallowed the thousands of ballista shots, so that not one of them could approach the body of the witch who had summoned it.
Steam (ST): That massive falling tower and its rubble... sucked in the thousands of ballista shots, so that not one of them approached the body of the witch who had summoned it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That massive falling tower and its rubble, sucked in the thousands of ballista shots, so that not one of them approached the body of the witch who had summoned it.
PC Japanese (JP): その墜落する巨大塔とその瓦礫は、数千にも至るバリスタ弾を飲み込み、呼び出した魔女の身にたった一本も近づけない。
Russian (RU): Эта массивная упавшая башня и её булыжники всосали тысячи баллистовых выстрелов, и ни один не достиг ведьмы, призвавшей её.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A copiosa torre caiu, fazendo destroços saltarem em todas as direções...engolindo os milhares de tiros de balista, fazendo assim que nenhum deles se aproximasse do corpo da bruxa que a havia invocado.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 墜落的巨大塔與其瓦礫，吞沒了數以千計的巨型弩箭，不會讓哪怕一支箭接近喚它出來的魔女之身。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 坠落的巨大塔与其瓦砾，吞没了数以千计的巨型弩箭，不会让哪怕一支箭接近唤它出来的魔女之身。

Umineko Project (UP): Yes, none can approach the mysteries of heaven.{n}That was the truth of the Fallen Tower.
Steam (ST): That's right, no group of people, no matter how large, could approach the mysteries of heaven. That was the reality of the fallen tower.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That's right, no one could approach the mysteries of heaven. That was the reality of the fallen tower.
PC Japanese (JP): そう、天の神秘には何人たりとも近づけないのだ。それこそが墜落せし塔の真実。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): そう、天の神秘には何人たりとも近づけないのだ。{n}それこそが墜落せし塔の真実。
Russian (RU): Да, никто не мог приблизиться к тайнам небес.{n}Такова была реальность павшей башни.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sim, ninguém pode se aproximar dos mistérios do céu.{n}Esta é a verdade das Torres Caídas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 對，無論來多少人，都無法接近天的神秘。{n}這即是墜落之塔的真實。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 对，无论来多少人，都无法接近天的神秘。{n}这即是坠落之塔的真实。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "As I would expect from you, Master! If you do something, you always do it big!! Kuhhuhu{0}hu{0}huhya{0}hyahya!!"
Steam (ST): "As I'd expect from you, Teacher! If you do something, you always do it big!! Khehhhuhuhuhuhyahyahya!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "As I would expect from you, Teacher! If you do something, you always do it big!! Kuhhuhuhuhuhyahyahya!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「さすがお師匠様ァ！　いちいちやることがデケェや！！くっひひひひひゃっひゃっひゃ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「さすがお師匠様ァ！　いちいちやることがデケェや！！　くっひひひひひゃっひゃっひゃ！！」
Russian (RU): "Чего я и ожидала от Вас, наставница! Если вы чего‐то делаете, то делаете масштабно! Ку‐ху‐ху‐ха‐ха‐ха!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Como esperado de você, professora! Se você faz algo, é sempre algo grande!! Kuhhuhu{0}hu{0}huhya{0}hyahya!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不愧是師傅大人！出手全是大手筆！！咕、嘻嘻嘻嘻嚇、嚇、嚇！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不愧是师傅大人！出手全是大手笔！！咕、嘻嘻嘻嘻吓、吓、吓！！」

Umineko Project (UP): "My turn isn't over. Come, arise, Sons of Ivaldi. Bestow upon me a worthy spear!"
Steam (ST): "My turn isn't over. Come, arise, Sons of Ivaldi. Bestow upon me a worthy spear."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "My turn isn't over. Come, arise, Sons of Ivaldi. Bestow upon me a worthy spear."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私の手番は終わりませんよ。さぁさお出でなさい、イヴァルディの息子たち。我に相応しき槍を与え給えっ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私の手番は終わりませんよ。さぁさお出でなさい、イヴァルディの息子たち。我に相応しき槍を与え給えっ」
Russian (RU): "Мой ход пока ещё не завершен. Явитесь, восстаньте, сыны Ивальдьевы. Даруйте мне достойное копье."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Meu turno ainda não terminou. Vamos, venham, Filhos de Ivaldi. Tragam para mim a lança entregue por Deus!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我的回合還沒有結束哦。來——來，出來吧，{c:86EF9C:伊凡爾迪的兒子們}。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“神話相關”條目）}給予吾相稱的長槍。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我的回合还没有结束哦。来——来，出来吧，{c:86EF9C:伊凡尔迪的儿子们}。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“神话相关”条目）}给予吾相称的长枪。」

Umineko Project (UP): As the massive crimson tower that had fallen made a mighty gold‐colored explosion, from inside those flames, a spear showed itself, of such massive proportions that you had to look up to see all of it, much like a tower.
Steam (ST): As the massive crimson tower that had fallen made a terrible gold-colored explosion, a massive spear appeared from inside those flames, so tall, like a tower, that you had to look up to see all of it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the massive crimson tower that had fallen made a terrible gold-colored explosion, from inside those flames, a massive spear showed itself, so tall, like a tower, that you had to look up to see all of it.
PC Japanese (JP): 墜落する紅蓮の巨大塔は黄金色の凄まじい爆発を起こすと、その爆炎の中より、塔のように見上げなければならぬほどの巨大な槍が姿を現す。
Russian (RU): Упавшая ранее массивная багровая башня взорвалась с золотой вспышкой, и из возникшего пламени показалось копье, такое длинное, словно башня, чтобы осмотреть которую приходилось задирать голову.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a hirta torre carmesim que caiu dos céus explodiu de forma poderosa com uma tonalidade dourada, do interior daquelas chamas, uma lança surgiu, de tamanha proporção, sendo necessário olhar para cima para ver sua ponta, bem como as torres.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 伴隨著墜落下來的紅蓮巨塔所產生的黃金色的巨大爆炸，在這爆炸之焰中，出現了不得不像仰望塔般抬頭仰視的巨大長槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 伴随着坠落下来的红莲巨塔所产生的黄金色的巨大爆炸，在这爆炸之焰中，出现了不得不像仰望塔般抬头仰视的巨大长枪。

Umineko Project (UP): ...It was too large for even a giant's hand.
Steam (ST): ...It was too large even for a giant's hand.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...It was even too large for a giant's hand.
PC Japanese (JP): …その大きさは巨人の手にもまだ余る。
Russian (RU): ...Оно было велико даже для руки великана.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Era grande o bastante até mesmo para a mão de um titã.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …大得連巨人之手都無法握住。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …大得连巨人之手都无法握住。

Umineko Project (UP): It was a divinely beautiful spear of the gods, so massive that it gave the illusion that the tower which had fallen had turned into a spear of the same size. A spear of certain victory that no one could escape.
Steam (ST): That divinely beautiful Spear of the Gods was so massive, it gave the illusion that the fallen tower had turned into a spear of the same size. It was a spear of certain victory that none could escape.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was a divinely beautiful Spear of the Gods, so massive that it gave the illusion that the tower which had fallen had turned into a spear of the same size. A spear of certain victory that no one could escape.
PC Japanese (JP): 先ほどの墜落する塔がそのまま槍になったかと錯覚するほどに巨大な、そして神々しく美しい神の槍。如何なる者も逃がさぬ必勝の槍。
Russian (RU): То определённо было прекрасное Копьё Богов, столь массивное, что создавало иллюзию, будто упавшая по призыву ведьмы башня обратилась в копьё того же размера. Копьё неизбежной победы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era uma lança dos deuses, divinamente bela, tão grande que dava a ilusão de que a torre que havia caído transformou‐se em um lança de mesmo tamanho. Uma lança da vitória concreta que ninguém poderia escapar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它巨大到能讓人錯以為，先前墜落的塔就那樣化做了長槍。此乃神聖美麗的神之槍。無論何人都逃不過的，必勝之槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它巨大到能让人错以为，先前坠落的塔就那样化做了长枪。此乃神圣美丽的神之枪。无论何人都逃不过的，必胜之枪。

Umineko Project (UP): "It looks like your twin towers are useless. How foolish that you blocked off your means of escape on both sides. You can't defend against even a single spear!"
Steam (ST): "Looks like your twin towers won't help you now. How foolish, to block off your means of escape on both sides. You can't defend against even a single spear!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Looks like your twin towers are useless. How foolish that you blocked off your means of escape on both sides. You can't defend against even a single spear!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「無用の双子塔ですね。自ら左右の退路を絶つとは愚かしいっ。一本の槍をもお前は防げない！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「無用の双子塔ですね。自ら左右の退路を断つとは愚かしいっ。一本の槍をもお前は防げない！」
Russian (RU): "Похоже, твои башни‐близнецы бесполезны. Как неразумно отрезать пути к побегу с двух сторон. Ты не можешь защититься даже от одного копья!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Parece que suas torres gêmeas são inúteis. Quanta tolice bloquear suas rotas de fuga de ambos os lados. Você não pode sequer se defender de uma única lança!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「無用的雙子塔呢。自行封住左右的退路，可真是愚蠢。你連這一杆槍，都已無從抵御！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「无用的双子塔呢。自行封住左右的退路，可真是愚蠢。你连这一杆枪，都已无从抵御！」

Umineko Project (UP): When she snapped her fingers in command, the massive tower‐like spear shot at {f:5:Beatrice} like a lightning bolt.
Steam (ST): When she snapped her fingers in command, the massive tower-sized spear shot at {f:5:Beatrice} like a lightning bolt.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When she snapped her fingers in command, the massive tower-like spear shot at Beatrice like a lightning bolt.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女が指を鳴らして命じると、塔の如き巨大槍は、一条の稲妻のように、ベアトリーチェを目指す。
Russian (RU): Когда она щёлкнула пальцами, массивное кольцо величиной с башню молниеносно полетело в {f:5:Беатриче}.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando ela deu o comando estalando seus dedos, a enorme lança equivalente a torre disparou contra {f:5:Beatrice} como um relâmpago.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她打了個響指，隨著這一聲令下，如塔般巨大的長槍，猶如一道閃電，直奔貝阿朵莉切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她打了个响指，随着这一声令下，如塔般巨大的长枪，犹如一道闪电，直奔贝阿朵莉切。

Umineko Project (UP): As the Golden Witch danced in the gap between the towers like a butterfly, it sliced straight through the air like a flash of lightning, aiming right for the very middle of the absolute center of her heart, with the most ultimate and extreme precision.
Steam (ST): It aimed right for the middle of the center of the Golden Witch's heart with extreme precision, as she danced in the gap between the towers like a butterfly, slicing straight through the air like a flash of lightning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It aimed right for the middle of the center of the Golden Witch's heart with extreme precision, as she danced in the gap between the towers like a butterfly, slicing straight through the air like a flash of lightning.
PC Japanese (JP): 左右の塔の狭間にて蝶のように舞う黄金の魔女の、心臓のど真ん中の中心のさらにさらに中央を、超が七つ付く精密さで狙い、稲光のようにまっすぐ宙を駆け抜ける。
Russian (RU): Оно было нацелено в сердце Золотой Ведьмы с ужасающей точностью, пока та, подобно бабочке, танцевала в проеме между башнями, прорезав воздух как вспышка молнии.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Enquanto a Bruxa Dourada dançava entre o vazio das torres como uma borboleta, a lança perfurou diretamente através do ar como o flash de um relâmpago, almejando o centro absoluto de seu coração, com a maior e mais extrema precisão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 以可以加七個“超”的精密度，瞄準了在左右雙塔之間，如蝴蝶般飄舞的黃金魔女，的心臟中心處的最最最中央，如閃電般直直地劃破長空。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 以可以加七个“超”的精密度，瞄准了在左右双塔之间，如蝴蝶般飘舞的黄金魔女，的心脏中心处的最最最中央，如闪电般直直地划破长空。

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Hah!! So, you use Gungnir in a place like this!! You really are incredible, Masteeeerrrrr!!"
Steam (ST): "Hah!! So, you use Gungnir at a moment like this!! You really are incredible, Teacheeeeeer!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hah!! So, you use Gungnir in a place like this!! You really are incredible, Teacheeeeeer!!
PC Japanese (JP): 「はッ！！　こんなところでグングニルが引けるとはッ！！　やっぱりお師匠様はすげェなああぁあ！！
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「はッ！！　こんなところでグングニルが引けるとはッ！！　やっぱりお師匠様はすげェなああぁあ！！」
Russian (RU): "Ха! Так вы используете Гунгнир в таком месте! Вы воистину невероятны, наставница!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Hah!! Então você usou a Gungnir em uma lugar como este!! Você é mesmo incrível, professooorraaaaaaa!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哈！！竟能在這種地方抽出{c:86EF9C:昆古尼爾}！！{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“神話相關”條目）}果然，師傅大人就是厲害啊啊啊啊！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哈！！竟能在这种地方抽出{c:86EF9C:昆古尼尔}！！{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“神话相关”条目）}果然，师傅大人就是厉害啊啊啊啊！！」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Explode, useless towers! Arise, Giant Soldier Battle Line. Fully block that divine spear with your shields and chests!!"
Steam (ST): "Burst, useless towers! Arise, Giant Soldier Battle Line. Fully block that divine spear with your shields and chests!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Explode, useless towers! Arise, Giant Soldier Battle Line. Fully block that divine spear with your shields and chests!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 爆ぜろ、役立たずの塔！　出でよ、巨人兵の戦列よ。その楯と胸で、神なる槍を防ぎきれ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「爆ぜろ、役立たずの塔！　出でよ、巨人兵の戦列よ。その楯と胸で、神なる槍を防ぎきれ！！」
Russian (RU): "Взорвитесь, бесполезные башни! Восстаньте, Гигантские боевые строи солдат. Полностью заблокируйте божественное копьё своими грудью и щитами!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Explodam, frívolas torres! Levantem‐se, Soldados Gigantes de Linha de Batalha. Bloqueiem por completo aquela lança divina como seus escudos e arcabouços!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「爆散吧，沒用的塔！出來吧，巨人兵的戰列。以汝等的盾與胸膛，擋住神槍！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「爆散吧，没用的塔！出来吧，巨人兵的战列。以汝等的盾与胸膛，挡住神枪！！」

Umineko Project (UP): The Shoulder War Towers exploded in gold.{n}They became several billion gold butterflies.
Steam (ST): The Shoulder War Towers exploded in gold. They became several billion gold butterflies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Shoulder War Towers exploded in gold. They became several billion gold butterflies.
PC Japanese (JP): 双肩の戦塔は黄金色の大爆発を起こす。それは何億もの黄金の蝶たち。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 双肩の戦塔は黄金色の大爆発を起こす。{n}それは何億もの黄金の蝶たち。
Russian (RU): Надплечные боевые башни взорвались золотом.{n}Они превратились в несколько миллиардов золотых бабочек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): As Torres Ombreiras De Guerra explodiram em ouro.{n}Elas se tornaram dezenas de bilhões de borboletas douradas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雙肩戰塔發生了黃金色的大爆炸。{n}化為了數億只黃金蝶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 双肩战塔发生了黄金色的大爆炸。{n}化为了数亿只黄金蝶。

Umineko Project (UP): Those butterflies took the shape of seven massive armored soldiers.
Steam (ST): Those butterflies took the shape of seven massive armored soldiers.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Those butterflies took the shape of seven massive armored soldiers.
PC Japanese (JP): その蝶たちが７人の巨人装甲兵を模る。
Russian (RU): А затем эти бабочки приняли облик семи массивных солдат в полном вооружении.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aquelas borboletas tomaram a forma de sete imensos soldados de armadura.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這些蝴蝶化為了七位巨人裝甲兵的形象。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这些蝴蝶化为了七位巨人装甲兵的形象。

Umineko Project (UP): Each stretched a full 50 merute into the sky, and they lined up in front of {f:5:Beatrice}, protecting their master and holding massive shields which towered like windmills.
Steam (ST): Each stretched a full 50 merute into the sky, and they lined up in front of {f:5:Beatrice}, protecting their master and holding massive shields that towered like windmills.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Each stretched a full 50 merute into the sky, and they lined up in front of Beatrice, protecting their master and holding massive shields which towered like windmills.
PC Japanese (JP): それぞれが５０メルテもの見上げるばかりの身長を持ち、そびえ立つ風車のような大きさの巨大楯をかざしてベアトリーチェの前に並んで主を守る。
Russian (RU): Каждый был ростом в 50 мерутов, и они образовали строй перед {f:5:Беатриче}, защищая свою госпожу, держа массивные щиты и возвышаясь как огромные мельницы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada um com uma altura de completos 50 merute em direção ao céu, e alinhados em frente à {f:5:Beatrice}, protegendo sua mestra enquanto seguravam imensos escudos que se assemelhavam a moinhos de vento.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 各自有著令人仰視的，高達五十梅爾泰的身高，舉著如矗立的風車般大小的巨大盾牌，並排在貝阿朵莉切身前，保護主人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 各自有着令人仰视的，高达五十梅尔泰的身高，举着如矗立的风车般大小的巨大盾牌，并排在贝阿朵莉切身前，保护主人。

Umineko Project (UP): Their massive size was evocative of a mountain range. The witch hiding behind them was like a small moon hiding behind the mountains.
Steam (ST): They were as massive as a mountain range. The witch behind them was like a small moon hiding behind the mountains.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They were as massive as a mountain range. The witch hiding behind them was like a small moon hiding behind the mountains.
PC Japanese (JP): その巨大さは山脈さえも連想させる。その向こうに隠れる魔女は、さながら山の向こうに隠れる小さな月のようだった。
Russian (RU): По массивности они могли сравниться с горной грядой. Прячущаяся за ними ведьма напоминала луну, скрывающуюся за горами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Suas medidas imanes eram evocativas a uma cadeia de montanhas.{n}A bruxa escondeu‐se atrás deles, como uma pequena Lua que se esconde atrás das montanhas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 他們的巨大，甚至能讓人聯想到山脈。在他們身後躲避著的魔女，就像是藏在山的另一邊的小小月亮。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 他们的巨大，甚至能让人联想到山脉。在他们身后躲避着的魔女，就像是藏在山的另一边的小小月亮。

Umineko Project (UP): Once in the past, when the massive shields these giants held had been readied by the whole giants' regiment, they had protected King Wilhelm's castle not only from arrows, but from the wind and the rain, and when they had faced upwards and held their shields to the heavens, not a single raindrop had gotten through.
Steam (ST): Once in the past, when the massive shields these giants held had been readied by the whole regiment, they had protected King Whilhelm's castle not only from arrows, but from the wind and the rain, for when they had faced upwards and held their shields to the heavens, not a single raindrop had gotten through.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Once in the past, when the massive shields these giants held had been readied by the whole giants regiment, they had protected King Whilhelm's castle not only from arrows, but from the wind and the rain, and when they had faced upwards and held their shields to the heavens, not a single raindrop had gotten through.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨人たちが構える巨大楯は、かつて巨人連隊全員が連なって構えた時、ヴィルヘルム王の居城を矢だけでなく、風雨からすら守り、天に向けてかざした時には雨粒の一滴すらも許さなかったという。
Russian (RU): Однажды в прошлом, когда эти щиты, что держали гиганты, были взяты на изготовку целым полком великанов, они служили защитой замку короля Вильгельма не только от стрел, но и от ветра с дождём, а когда они глядели вверх и поднимали щиты, ни одна капля не могла проскользнуть между ними.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Uma vez, no passado, quando os colossais escudos que aqueles gigantes seguravam foram preparados por todo o regimento dos gigantes, eles protegeram o castelo do Rei Wilhelm, não apenas de arcos, mas dos ventos e chuvas, e quando eles direcionam seus escudos para os céus, nenhuma única gota de chuva passou por eles.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 據說這由巨人們舉著的巨大盾牌，在以前由巨人聯隊一同舉起之時，不僅能保護威爾海姆王的居城不受箭矢侵襲，甚至連風雨也一樣，將盾舉向天空時，就連一粒雨滴都不容落入王城。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 据说这由巨人们举着的巨大盾牌，在以前由巨人联队一同举起之时，不仅能保护威尔海姆王的居城不受箭矢侵袭，甚至连风雨也一样，将盾举向天空时，就连一粒雨滴都不容落入王城。

Umineko Project (UP): "Foolish. How pitiful is the witch who has forgotten her respect for the divine. Did you think that giants could defend against a spear of the gods?!"
Steam (ST): "Foolish. The shame of a witch who has forgotten to respect things sacred. Did you think mere giants could defend against a Spear of the Gods?!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Foolish. The misery of a witch who has forgotten to respect things sacred. Did you think that giants could defend against a Spear of the Gods?!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「愚かな。神聖への敬いを忘れた魔女の憐れなことです。神の槍を巨人如きで防げるとお思いですか！」
Russian (RU): "Как глупо. Убожество ведьмы, забывшей об уважении к святым вещам. Ты думаешь, что великаны смогут защитить от Копья богов?!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Tolice. Quão vergonhosa é uma bruxa que esqueceu do respeito perante o divino. Você acha que esses gigantes podem defender você de uma lança dos deuses?!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「愚蠢。這正是忘卻了對神聖致以敬意的魔女的可悲之處。還以為區區巨人就能擋住神之槍！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「愚蠢。这正是忘却了对神圣致以敬意的魔女的可悲之处。还以为区区巨人就能挡住神之枪！」

Speaker: Ronove
Umineko Project (UP): "......Indeed. No matter how much human metal you are armed with, you cannot block a spear of the gods. A wonderful epaulette mate by Madam."
Steam (ST): "...Indeed. No matter how much human metal you are armed with, you cannot block a Spear of the Gods. A wonderful Epaulette Mate by Madam."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Indeed. No matter how much human metal you are armed with, you cannot block a Spear of the Gods. A wonderful Epaulette Mate by Madam."
PC Japanese (JP): 「……道理ですね。人間の金属でいくら武装しようとも、神の槍は防げません。マダムの見事なエポレットメイトです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……道理ですね。人間の金属でいくら武装しようとも、神の槍は防げません。マダムの見事なエポレットメイトです」
Russian (RU): "......Согласен. Сколько бы людского металла тебя ни защищало, он не способен выстоять против Копья богов. Чудесный мат в исполнении Мадам."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......De fato. Não importa com quanto metal humano esteja armada, você não pode bloquear uma lança dos deuses. Um magnífico mate epaulet da Madame."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……甚是在理呢。以人類的金屬，無論怎麼武裝，都是擋不住神之槍的。女士好一著，{c:86EF9C:{ruby:eqaulette mate:雙肩困殺}}。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“國際象棋術語”條目）}」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……甚是在理呢。以人类的金属，无论怎么武装，都是挡不住神之枪的。女士好一着，{c:86EF9C:{ruby:eqaulette mate:双肩困杀}}。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“国际象棋术语”条目）}」

Speaker: Lucifer
Umineko Project (UP): "No way?! {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama!!"
Steam (ST): "No way! {f:5:Beatrice}-sama?!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No way?! Beatrice-sama!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「そんなっ？！　ベアトリーチェさまッ！！」
Russian (RU): "Как же так?! {f:5:Беатриче}‐сама!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Sem chance?! {f:5:Beatrice}‐sama!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「怎麼會？！貝阿朵莉切夫人！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「怎么会？！贝阿朵莉切夫人！！」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Of course I haven't forgotten, Master! Come, arise, Hephaestus and his disciples. Bestow upon me a worthy shieeeld!!"
Steam (ST): "Of course I haven't forgotten, Teacher! Come arise, disciples of Hephaestus. Bestow upon me a worthy shield!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Of course I haven't forgotten, Teacher! Come arise, disciples of Hephaestus. Bestow upon me a worthy shield!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「もちろん忘れませんとも、お師匠様ァ！さぁさお出でなさい、ヘパイストスと弟子たち。我に相応しき楯を与え給えぇえ！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「もちろん忘れませんとも、お師匠様ァ！　さぁさお出でなさい、ヘパイストスと弟子たち。我に相応しき楯を与え給えぇえ！！」
Russian (RU): "Разумеется не забыла, наставница! Явитесь, восстаньте, ученики Гефеста. Даруйте мне достойный щит!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É claro que eu não me esqueci, professora! Venha, levantem‐se, Hefesto e seus discípulos. Concedam a mim um escudo de valoooor!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我當然沒忘哦，師傅大人！來——來，出來吧，{c:86EF9C:赫斐斯托斯}與其徒弟們。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“神話相關”條目）}給予吾相稱的盾牌！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我当然没忘哦，师傅大人！来——来，出来吧，{c:86EF9C:赫斐斯托斯}与其徒弟们。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“神话相关”条目）}给予吾相称的盾牌！！」

Umineko Project (UP): A golden whirlwind arose at the feet of the Giant Soldiers.{n}It was a group of countless butterflies.
Steam (ST): A golden whirlwind arose at the feet of the Giant Soldiers. It was a cloud of countless butterflies.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A golden whirlwind arose at the feet of the Giant Soldiers. It was a group of countless butterflies.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨人兵たちの足元より黄金の旋風が巻き起こる。それは無数の黄金蝶たちの群。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 巨人兵たちの足元より黄金の旋風が巻き起こる。{n}それは無数の黄金蝶たちの群れ。
Russian (RU): У ног солдат‐великанов возник золотой вихрь.{n}Он представлял собой неисчислимое сборище бабочек.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um dourado redemoinho surgiu nos pés dos Soldados Gigantes.{n}Era um grupo de incontáveis borboletas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在巨人兵們的腳邊捲起了黃金旋風。{n}那正是無數的黃金蝴蝶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在巨人兵们的脚边卷起了黄金旋风。{n}那正是无数的黄金蝴蝶。

Umineko Project (UP): ...They attached themselves to the massive shields like gold leaf, sparkling like they were a gold mirror.
Steam (ST): ...They attached themselves to the massive shields like gold leaf, sparkling like they were a gold mirror.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): …それらが金箔のように巨大楯に張り付くと、まるで黄金の鏡のようにぎらぎらと光る。
Russian (RU): ...Они опустились на массивные щиты подобно золотым листьям, сверкая, словно являясь золотой бронёй.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Elas juntaram‐se aos colossais escudos, como folhas douradas, reluzindo como se fossem um espelho de ouro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …它們如金箔般貼上黃金盾牌，使之宛如黃金鏡般閃閃發光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …它们如金箔般贴上黄金盾牌，使之宛如黄金镜般闪闪发光。

Umineko Project (UP): That was the absolute defensive wall that the King of the Gods gave to the goddess.{n}The Aegis Shield.
Steam (ST): It was the absolute defensive wall given to a goddess by the chief of the gods. The Aegis Shield.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): That was the absolute defensive wall given to the chief god by the goddess. The Aegis Shield.
PC Japanese (JP): それこそは主神が女神に与えた絶対の防御壁。アイギスの楯。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それこそは主神が女神に与えた絶対の防御壁。{n}アイギスの楯。
Russian (RU): То была абсолютная линия защиты, дарованная главным богом богине.{n}Эгида.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era a absoluta muralha de defesa que o Rei dos Deus deu à sua deusa.{n}O Escudo Égide.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這正是主神給予女神的絕對防御壁。{n}{c:86EF9C:埃癸斯之盾}。{c:86EF9C:（詳見魔導書“神話相關”條目）}
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这正是主神给予女神的绝对防御壁。{n}{c:86EF9C:埃癸斯之盾}。{c:86EF9C:（详见魔导书“神话相关”条目）}

Umineko Project (UP): When the holy spear, which left a dignified tail behind it like a comet, crashed into the mountain range of that gold shield, there was a terrible thunderous roar. It was the creaking of the pillars that held up the heavens.
Steam (ST): When the holy spear, which left a dignified tail behind it like a comet, crashed into the mountain range of that gold shield, there was a terrible thunderous roar. It was the creaking of the pillars that held up the heavens.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When the holy spear, which left a dignified tail behind it like a comet, crashed into the mountain range of that gold shield, there was a terrible thunderous roar. It was the creaking of the pillars that held up the heavens.
PC Japanese (JP): 彗星の如く威厳ある尾を引いた神なる槍がその黄金楯の山脈に激突した時。凄まじい轟音が鳴り響いた。それは天空を支える柱たちが一斉に軋む音。
Russian (RU): Когда святое копьё, оставляя в своём полёте хвост, подобно комете, врезалась в горную гряду золотого щита, раздался громогласный рёв. То был скрип колонн, поддерживающих небесный свод.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando a lança sagrada, que deixou para trás uma digna cauda, assim como um cometa, colidiu nos escudos de ouro do tamanho de uma cadeia de montanhas, houve um terrível rugido estrondoso. Era o ranger dos pilares que suportavam os céus.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如彗星般拖著莊嚴長尾的神槍與黃金盾的山脈激突之時。駭人的轟聲響徹寰宇。這是支撐天空的柱子一齊顫動的聲音。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如彗星般拖着庄严长尾的神枪与黄金盾的山脉激突之时。骇人的轰声响彻寰宇。这是支撑天空的柱子一齐颤动的声音。

Umineko Project (UP): The Divine Spear spun around and around, sent flying in the direction the sun sets.
Steam (ST): The Divine Spear spun around and around...and was sent flying in the direction of the setting sun.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Divine Spear spun around and around, and was sent flying in the direction of the sinking sun.
PC Japanese (JP): 神槍はぐるぐると回りながら日の沈む方角へ弾き飛ばされる。
Russian (RU): Божественное копьё, вращаясь, отправилось в полёт в направлении солнечного заката.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A Lança Divina girou de um lado para o outro, e foi mandada voando na direção em que o sol descansa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 神槍轉著圈，朝日落的方向彈飛了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 神枪转着圈，朝日落的方向弹飞了。

Speaker: Belphegor
Umineko Project (UP): "Impossible... Sh‐she defended against the Divine Spear...!!"
Steam (ST): "Impossible... She defended against the Divine Spear...!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Impossible...  She defended against the Divine Spear...!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありえない…。し、神槍を防いだ…！！」
Russian (RU): "Не может быть... Она защитилась от Божественного копья!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Impossível... E‐Ela se defendeu da Lança Divina...!!"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不可能…。防、防住了神槍…！！」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不可能…。防、防住了神枪…！！」

Speaker: Ronove
Umineko Project (UP): "No, that is not correct. The holy spear avoided the impact. It is the law of the gods that an absolute spear and an absolute shield must not fight each other. Although in the end, it means the same thing as defending against it."
Steam (ST): "No, that is not correct. The divine spear avoided her. It is the law of the gods that an absolute spear and an absolute shield must never fight one another. Although, in the end, it means the same thing as defending against it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No, that is not correct. She avoided the holy spear. It is the law of the gods that an absolute spear and an absolute shield must not fight each other. Although in the end, it means the same thing as defending against it."
PC Japanese (JP): 「いいえ違います。神なる槍がよけたのです。絶対の槍と絶対の楯は争ってはいけないのが神々の掟。それはつまり、防いだのと同じことですがね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「いいえ違います。神なる槍がよけたのです。絶対の槍と絶対の楯は争ってはいけないのが神々の掟。それはつまり、防いだのと同じことですがね」
Russian (RU): "Нет, это не совсем так. Она избежала святого копья. По законам богов абсолютное копьё и абсолютный щит не должны испытывать друг друга. Хотя, в конечном итоге, это всё равно что защититься от него."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não, isto não está correto. A lança sagrada desviou do impacto. É a Lei dos deuses que uma absoluta lança e um absoluto escudo não devem lutar um contra o outro. Embora acabe por significar o mesmo que se defender dela."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不，錯了。是神槍自己避開的。絕對之槍與絕對之盾不可爭鬥，這是諸神的戒律。不過換言之，這與防住了相同呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「不，错了。是神枪自己避开的。绝对之枪与绝对之盾不可争斗，这是诸神的戒律。不过换言之，这与防住了相同呢。」

Umineko Project (UP): "..................Churlish fighting appears to be the only area in which your skills have improved."
Steam (ST): ".........Your skills have improved from engaging in these fights so often."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "..................Your skills have improved from engaging in these fights all the time."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………………このような荒事ばかり腕をあげましたね。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………………このような荒事ばかり腕をあげましたね」
Russian (RU): "..................Твои навыки улучшились от постоянного участия в таких сражениях."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "..................Uma grosseira luta aparenta ser a única área onde suas habilidades se desenvolveram."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………………盡是在此等動粗的方面上長本事呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………………尽是在此等动粗的方面上长本事呢。」

Speaker: {f:5:Beatrice}
Umineko Project (UP): "Or rather, it seems that you are still as bad as ever at this kind of game, Master. It's my turn to strike back. I shall follow the code and counter a spear with a spear."
Steam (ST): "Or rather, it seems you're still as bad as ever at this kind of game, Teacher. It's my turn to strike back. I shall follow the code and counter a spear with a spear."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Or rather, it seems that you are still as bad as ever at this kind of game, Teacher. It's my turn to strike back. I shall follow the code and counter a spear with a spear."
PC Japanese (JP): 「むしろお師匠様はこういうお遊びが相変わらず苦手なようで。妾からのお返しだ。法典に則り槍には槍でお返ししましょうぞ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「むしろお師匠様はこういうお遊びが相変わらず苦手なようで。妾からのお返しだ。法典に則り槍には槍でお返ししましょうぞ」
Russian (RU): "Скорее, это у вас, наставница, плохо получается играть в такие игры. Теперь мой черёд наносить удар. Я последую кодексу и отвечу копьём на копьё."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ou melhor, parece que você continua péssima como sempre nesse tipo de jogo, professora. É minha vez de contra‐atacar. Eu devo seguir o código e contragolpear uma lança com uma lança."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「倒不如說，師傅大人，您依然不擅長玩這種遊戲呢。這是妾身的還禮。遵照法典，就以槍還槍吧。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「倒不如说，师傅大人，您依然不擅长玩这种游戏呢。这是妾身的还礼。遵照法典，就以枪还枪吧。」

Umineko Project (UP): The Giant Soldier Battle Line, which had fully blocked the Divine Spear, released their holy gold shields.
Steam (ST): The Giant Soldier Battle Line, which had fully blocked the Divine Spear, released its holy gold shields.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 神槍を防ぎきった巨人兵の戦列は、神なる黄金の楯を手放す。
Russian (RU): Боевой строй солдат‐великанов, полностью заблокировавший Божественное копьё, опустили святые золотые щиты.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os Gigantes Soldados de Linha de Batalha, que haviam cumprido com sua tarefa de bloquear a Lança Divina, se desfizeram de seus dourados escudos sagrados.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 抵御住神槍的巨人兵戰列放下了神之黃金盾。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 抵御住神枪的巨人兵战列放下了神之黄金盾。

Umineko Project (UP): The shields fell to the earth, making the ground shake.
Steam (ST): The shields fell to the earth, making the ground shake.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The shields fell to the earth, making the ground shake.
PC Japanese (JP): 楯は大地に倒れ、地響きを上げた。
Russian (RU): Щиты упали на землю, вызывав землетрясение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Os escudos caíram na terra, fazendo o chão tremer.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 盾倒在大地上，發出了巨響。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 盾倒在大地上，发出了巨响。

Umineko Project (UP): And then another gold whirlwind arose, and the seven gold shields changed their form into seven massive spears of lightning lying on the ground.
Steam (ST): When they did, another gold whirlwind arose, and the seven gold shields changed their form into seven massive spears of lightning lying on the ground.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When they did, another gold whirlwind arose, and the seven gold shields changed their form into seven massive spears of lightning lying on the ground.
PC Japanese (JP): すると再び黄金の旋風が巻き起こり、７つの黄金の楯を、７つの大地に横たわる巨大な稲妻槍に姿を変える。
Russian (RU): Как только это произошло, возник ещё один золотой вихрь, и семь золотых щитов превратились в семь массивных золотых копий, лежавших на земле.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E outro redemoinho surgiu, e os sete escudos dourados se transformaram em sete lanças infindas de relâmpagos que descansavam sobre o chão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 接著，再次捲起了黃金旋風，七面黃金盾變成了橫臥在大地上的七杆巨大的閃電槍。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 接着，再次卷起了黄金旋风，七面黄金盾变成了横卧在大地上的七杆巨大的闪电枪。

Umineko Project (UP): In unison, each of the giants lifted a leg high, and firmly stomped on the tips of the handles.
Steam (ST): At once, each of the giants lifted one of their legs high...and firmly stomped on the tips of the handles.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At once, each of the giants lifted one of their legs high, and firmly stomped on the tips of the handles.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨人たちは一斉に片足を大きく振り上げると、その柄の先端を強く踏みつける。
Russian (RU): Семь великанов одновременно высоко подняли ногу и твёрдо топнули на кончики рукояток.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Em uníssono, cada um dos gigantes levantou uma perna e, com firmeza, pisaram na ponta das lanças para levantá‐las.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 巨人們一齊單腳高高抬起，重重踩向槍柄的先端。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 巨人们一齐单脚高高抬起，重重踩向枪柄的先端。

Umineko Project (UP): As the earth shook with a thunderous sound, the seven lightning spears spun beautifully and flew up above the Giant Soldiers' heads.
Steam (ST): As the earth shook with a thunderous sound, the seven lightning spears spun beautifully and flew up above the Giant Soldiers' heads.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As the earth shook with a thunderous sound, the seven lightning spears spun beautifully and flew up above the Giant Soldiers' heads.
PC Japanese (JP): 轟音と地響きが鳴り響き、７つの稲妻槍が美しく回転しながら巨人兵たちの頭上に飛び上がった。
Russian (RU): Земля громогласно содрогнулась, семь копий‐молний красиво завращались и взлетели над головами солдат‐великанов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com a terra estremecida pelo violento som, as sete lanças de relâmpago rodopiaram belamente e voaram acima da cabeça dos Soldados Gigantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 轟鳴與巨響交相輝映，七杆閃電槍邊華美地旋轉著，邊飛到了巨人兵們的頭上。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 轰鸣与巨响交相辉映，七杆闪电枪边华美地旋转着，边飞到了巨人兵们的头上。

Umineko Project (UP): ...They covered everywhere in a spray of gold as they began to fall before the giants.
Steam (ST): ...They scattered into a golden splash and began to fall before the giants.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...They scattered into a golden splash and began to fall before the giants.
PC Japanese (JP): …それが黄金の飛沫を撒き散らしながら彼らの前に落ちてくる。
Russian (RU): ...Затем они разлетелись золотыми брызгами и стали падать перед великанами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...Elas cobriram tudo com um spray de ouro enquanto caiam à frente dos gigantes.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …然後，它們邊揮灑著黃金飛沫，邊在巨人面前落下。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …然后，它们边挥洒着黄金飞沫，边在巨人面前落下。

Umineko Project (UP): Each of the giants squared off, and with the force of their whole body, they kicked and smashed them into pieces.
Steam (ST): Each of the giants squared off, and with the force of their whole body, they kicked and smashed them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Each of the giants squared off, and with the force of their whole body, they kicked and smashed them.
PC Japanese (JP): 身構えた巨人たちは、それを渾身の脚力で蹴り砕く。
Russian (RU): Каждый из великанов, приняв боевую стойку, силой всего своего тела пнули и ударили их.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Cada um dos gigantes se posicionou em posição defensiva, e com a força de todo o corpo, eles pisaram e esmagaram elas em pedaços.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 擺好姿勢的巨人們，以渾身的力氣將其踢碎。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 摆好姿势的巨人们，以浑身的力气将其踢碎。

Umineko Project (UP): Those broken pieces numbered exactly 30 each, and became lightning spears of exactly the same size as the original,
Steam (ST): The broken pieces numbered exactly 30, and became lightning spears of exactly the same size as the originals...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The broken pieces numbered exactly 30, and became lightning spears of exactly the same size as the original,
PC Japanese (JP): 砕けた破片はそれぞれきっかり３０を数え、原型とまったく同じ大きさの稲妻槍となり、
Russian (RU): Разбитые части в количестве 30 штук, стали копьями‐молниями того же размера, что и оригинал,
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Aqueles pedaços totalizavam exatamente trinta partes, e se transformaram lanças do exato tamanho da original,
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一杆槍剛好 30 片碎片，它們各自再度變成了與原型同樣大小的閃電槍，
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一杆枪刚好 30 片碎片，它们各自再度变成了与原型同样大小的闪电枪，

Umineko Project (UP): which made 210 for all 7 of them; and all of those burst at once, each splitting into 30 thorns, so that there were 6,300.
Steam (ST): ...Which made 210 for the 7 giants. And all of those burst at once, with each splitting into 30 thorns, for a total of 6,300.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): which made 210 for all 7 of them, and all of those burst at once, and each of those split into 30 thorns, so that there were 6300.
PC Japanese (JP): それが７人で２１０本となり、それらは一斉に爆ぜて、さらに各々が３０本の棘に分裂して６３００本となり。
Russian (RU): что составило 210 от всех 7, а затем все они одновременно взорвались, после чего превратились в 30 шипов, и общее их количество составило 6300.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O que fez 210 a partir de 7 delas; e todas elas explodiram de uma só vez. cada uma se dividindo em 30 espinhos, o que dava um total de 6.300.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 因為有七人，所以變成了 210 杆，它們再度一齊爆散，又各自分裂成了 30 根尖刺，總共 6300 杆。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 因为有七人，所以变成了 210 杆，它们再度一齐爆散，又各自分裂成了 30 根尖刺，总共 6300 杆。

Umineko Project (UP): They became a thundercloud barrage, drawing out a beautiful geometric pattern, and then each of those changed into three bolts of lightning, so that 18,900 thunderbolts shot at the Predecessor {f:5:Beatrice}.
Steam (ST): They became a barrage of thunderclouds drawing a beautiful geometric pattern, and then each changed into three bolts of lightning, so that 18,900 thunderbolts shot at the Predecessor {f:5:Beatrice}.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): They became a barrage of thunderclouds drawing a beautiful geometric pattern, and then each of those changed into three bolts of lightning, so that 18,900 thunderbolts shot at Beatrice the Predecessor.
PC Japanese (JP): 美しい幾何学模様を描いた弾幕の雷雲となり、さらにそれが全て三叉の稲妻に姿を変え１８９００本の雷撃となって先代のベアトリーチェを撃つ。
Russian (RU): Они образовали шквал грозовых облаков, рисующих красивый геометрический рисунок, после чего каждое из них превратилось в три молнии, и в {f:5:Беатриче}‐предшественницу полетело 18900 молний.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eles se transformarem em uma barragem, como uma nuvem negra de trovões, desenhando um lindo padrão geométrico, e cada um deles se transformou em três relâmpagos de luz, o que fez com que 18.900 raios fossem disparados contra a {f:5:Beatrice} Antecessora.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它們化為描繪出美麗幾何學圖形的彈幕雷雲，緊接著，又全都變成了三叉閃電，以 18900 道雷擊襲向先代貝阿朵莉切。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它们化为描绘出美丽几何学图形的弹幕雷云，紧接着，又全都变成了三叉闪电，以 18900 道雷击袭向先代贝阿朵莉切。

Umineko Project (UP): "I would expect nothing less. ......From Madam."

Umineko Project (UP): Certainly, a bundle of almost 20,000 thunderbolts should have reduced the master's body to dust. But there was no impact.
Steam (ST): That bundle of almost 20,000 thunderbolts must have reduced the teacher's body to dust. But there had been no resistance.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Certainly, a bundle of almost 20,000 thunderbolts should have reduced the teacher's body to dust. But there was no impact.
PC Japanese (JP): ２万にも届きかねない稲妻の束は確かに師匠の体を塵に変えたはずだった。しかし手応えがない。
Russian (RU): Разумеется, рой почти 20000 молний должен был испепелить тело наставницы. Но удар не встретил сопротивления.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Certamente, lidar com quase 20.000 raios deveria reduzir o corpo de sua professora ao pó. Mas não houve impacto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 幾乎達到了兩萬道的閃電，確實應該已將師傅的身體燒為了灰燼。可是，沒有打中的感覺。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 几乎达到了两万道的闪电，确实应该已将师傅的身体烧为了灰烬。可是，没有打中的感觉。

Umineko Project (UP): {f:5:Beatrice} knew immediately that she had been fooled.
Steam (ST): {f:5:Beatrice} knew immediately that she had been fooled.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Beatrice knew immediately that she had been fooled.
PC Japanese (JP): ベアトリーチェは一杯食わされたとすぐに直感する。
Russian (RU): {f:5:Беатриче} тут же поняла, что её обдурили.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): {f:5:Beatrice} imediatamente soube que havia sido enganada.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 貝阿朵莉切馬上就憑直覺意識到，自己被擺了一道。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 贝阿朵莉切马上就凭直觉意识到，自己被摆了一道。

Umineko Project (UP): At that moment, from the direction the sun was supposed to set, she felt an impossible ray of sunlight.
Steam (ST): At that time, from the direction that the sun had supposedly set, she felt the impossible rays of sunlight.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, from the direction that the sun had supposedly sunk, she felt the impossible rays of sunlight.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、日が沈むはずの方角より、ありえない日の出の光を感じた。
Russian (RU): В тот момент из направления, где должно уже было зайти солнце, она ощутила невозможные лучи света.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele momento, da direção onde o Sol supostamente deveria descansar, ela sentiu um impossível raio e sol.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就在此時，從太陽下山的方向，感到了一股不可能有的日出時的光芒。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就在此时，从太阳下山的方向，感到了一股不可能有的日出时的光芒。

Umineko Project (UP): A brilliant ray of light shone on her profile.
Steam (ST): A brilliant ray of light shone on her profile.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A brilliant ray of light shone on her profile.
PC Japanese (JP): 眩しき一条の光が彼女の横顔を照らす。
Russian (RU): Сверкающие лучи света осветили её профиль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Um brilhante raio de luz iluminando seu perfil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 耀眼的一束光照亮了她的側臉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 耀眼的一束光照亮了她的侧脸。

Umineko Project (UP): It was the figure of the master, holding aloft the spear of the gods that had supposedly been repelled a short while ago.{n}...She bore a brilliant radiance like the sun on her back, and made it shine on the incarnation of darkness.
Steam (ST): It was the figure of her teacher, holding aloft the Spear of the Gods that had supposedly been repelled a short while ago. ...She bore a sparkle like the sun on her back and made it shine on the incarnation of darkness.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the figure of the teacher, holding aloft the Spear of the Gods that had supposedly been repelled a short while ago....She bore a sparkle like the sun on her back, and made it shine on the incarnation of darkness.
PC Japanese (JP): それはさっき弾かれたはずの神の槍を掲げる師匠の姿。…太陽の如き輝きを背負い、暗黒の化身を一条に照らす。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それはさっき弾かれたはずの神の槍を掲げる師匠の姿。{n}…太陽の如き輝きを背負い、暗黒の化身を一条に照らす。
Russian (RU): Это была фигура наставницы, держащей над собой Копьё Богов, которое недавно было вроде как отражено.{n}...За её спиной словно сияло солнце и казалось, что будто освещается сама инкарнация тьмы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era a figura de sua professora, segurando como um mastro, a lança dos deuses, que supostamente havia sido repelida momentos antes.{n}...Ela carregava um brilho radiante como o Sol em suas costas, e o fez brilhar na incarnação da escuridão.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 那是舉著剛才本應彈開了的神槍的師傅的身姿。{n}…背負著如太陽般的光輝，以一束光照亮暗黑的化身。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 那是举着刚才本应弹开了的神枪的师傅的身姿。{n}…背负着如太阳般的光辉，以一束光照亮暗黑的化身。

Umineko Project (UP): ...{f:5:Beatrice}, watching from there, was trapped like a mouse in a cage, cornered in a dead‐end formed by the Giant Soldier Battle Line.
Steam (ST): ...As {f:5:Beatrice} watched, she was trapped like a mouse in a cage, cornered in a dead end formed by the Giant Soldier Battle Line.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ...As Beatrice watched, she was trapped like a mouse in a cage, cornered in a dead-end formed by the Giant Soldier Battle Line.
PC Japanese (JP): …そこより見たベアトリーチェは、巨人兵の戦列で出来た縦の袋小路に自らを追い込んだ袋の鼠。
Russian (RU): ...Наблюдавшая это {f:5:Беатриче} оказалась в ловушке, словно мышь в клетке, загнанная в тупик, образованный боевым строем солдат‐великанов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ...{f:5:Beatrice}, assistindo dali, estava encurralada como um rato na ratoeira, em um beco sem saída formado pelos Soldados Gigantes de Linha de Batalha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): …從此處望去的貝阿朵莉切，就像是把自己逼進了以巨人兵戰列構成的縱向死胡同的瓮中之鱉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): …从此处望去的贝阿朵莉切，就像是把自己逼进了以巨人兵战列构成的纵向死胡同的瓮中之鳖。

Umineko Project (UP): By now, the Predecessor {f:5:Beatrice} had seized a position directly alongside the Giant Soldier Battle Line.
Steam (ST): By now, the Predecessor {f:5:Beatrice} had seized a position directly alongside that Line.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): By now, the Predecessor Beatrice had seized a position directly alongside the Giant Soldier Battle Line.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora, a {f:5:Beatrice} Antecessora havia assumido diretamente uma posição ao lado dos Gigantes Soldados de Linha de Batalha.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 此刻，先代贝阿朵莉切从巨人兵战列的正侧面，捕捉到了她的身影。

Steam (ST): "Playtime is over, {f:5:Beatrice}...!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Agora estamos dando fim ao jogo, {f:5:Beatrice}...!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「玩耍的时间到此结束了哦，贝阿朵莉切…！」

Steam (ST): "......Have I... exposed my flaaaaank...?!"

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E mais rápido do que {f:5:Beatrice} poderia estalar sua língua, a {f:5:Beatrice} Antecessora liberou a lança sagrada.

Umineko Project (UP): In mid‐air, it sprung up into the air once more, and changed its form once again.
Steam (ST): As it leapt through the air, it changed its form once more.

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 它在這空間中躍動了一次後，再次變換了模樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 它在这空间中跃动了一次后，再次变换了模样。

Umineko Project (UP): "Come, arise, Dvergar brothers. Bestow upon me the giant‐smashing Iron Hammer of Heaven!"
Steam (ST): "Come, arise, Dvergar brothers. Bestow upon me the giant-smashing Iron Hammer of heaven!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Come, arise, Dvergar brothers. Bestow upon me the giant-smashing Iron Hammer of heaven!"

Russian (RU): "Явитесь, восстаньте, братья Дуэргары. Даруйте мне сокрушающий великанов небесный Железный молот!"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos, levantem‐se, Irmãos Dvergar. Concedam a mim o gigante e esmagador Martelo de Aço dos Céus!"

Umineko Project (UP): "Giant Soldiers, protect me!!! What are you doing, you slowpokes!!!"
Steam (ST): "Giant soldiers, protect me!!! What are you doing, you blockheads?!!!"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Giant soldiers, protect me!!! What are you doing, you blockheads!!!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「巨人兵どもッ、妾を守れッ！！！何をしているかノロマどもッ！！！」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「巨人兵どもッ、妾を守れッ！！！　何をしているかノロマどもッ！！！」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「巨人兵们，保护妾身！！！在干什么呢，这群慢乌龟！！！」

Umineko Project (UP): By now it was no longer a spear, but the whirlwind of a massive hammer that raised a sound like a windstorm as it flew through the air.
Steam (ST): By now it was no longer a spear, but the whirlwind of a massive hammer that raised a sound like a windstorm as it flew through the air.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): それはもはや槍でなく、暴風のような音を立てながら飛んでくる巨大なる鎚の旋風。
Russian (RU): Теперь это уже было не копьё, а вихрь массивного молота, который, пролетая в воздухе, вызвал напоминающий ветровую бурю звук.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Agora não era mais uma lança, mas o redemoinho de um imenso martelo que trouxe consigo o som de uma tempestade enquanto voava pelo céu.

Umineko Project (UP): It was the legendary hammer that had shaken the King of the Frost Giants.{n}So the Giant Soldiers couldn't escape from that fear.
Steam (ST): It was the legendary hammer that had shaken even the King of the Frost Giants. So, the Giant Soldiers couldn't escape from that fear.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): It was the legendary hammer that had shaken the King of the Frost Giants. So the Giant Soldiers couldn't escape from that fear.
PC Japanese (JP): それは霜の巨人の王を震え上がらせた伝説の鎚。ゆえに巨人兵たちはその恐怖から逃れられない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): それは霜の巨人の王を震え上がらせた伝説の鎚。{n}ゆえに巨人兵たちはその恐怖から逃れられない。
Russian (RU): То был легендарный молот, позволивший одолеть Короля Ледяных великанов.{n}Так что солдатам‐великанам было не суждено избежать того страха.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Era um martelo lendário que havia abalado o Rei dos Gigantes da Geada.{n}Por isso, os Soldados Gigantes não poderiam escapar daquele temor.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這是令霜之巨人之王都不禁顫抖的傳說之錘。{n}故，巨人兵們無法逃脫這份恐懼。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这是令霜之巨人之王都不禁颤抖的传说之锤。{n}故，巨人兵们无法逃脱这份恐惧。

Umineko Project (UP): So no matter how much their master ordered them, they couldn't block the path of that hammer.
Steam (ST): So, regardless of how strongly their master ordered them, they couldn't get in the path of that hammer.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So no matter how much their master ordered them, they couldn't block the path of that hammer.
PC Japanese (JP): だからいくら主が命じようとも、その鎚の進路を遮ることができない。
Russian (RU): И как бы их госпожа не приказывала им, они не могли заблокировать тот молот.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Não importa o quanto sua mestra ordenasse, eles não poderiam bloquear o caminho daquele martelo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，無論主人怎麼命令，他們都無法堵住錘的行進路線。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，无论主人怎么命令，他们都无法堵住锤的行进路线。

Umineko Project (UP): Before the whirlwind of this massive chunk of metal, {f:5:Beatrice} was nothing more than a mere speck.
Steam (ST): Before the whirlwind of that massive chunk of metal, {f:5:Beatrice} was nothing more than a mere speck.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Before the whirlwind of this massive chunk of metal, Beatrice was nothing more than a mere speck.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨大な鉄塊の旋風の前に、ベアトリーチェなど一粒の豆に過ぎない。
Russian (RU): Перед вихрем этого массивного куска металла {f:5:Беатриче} была не более, чем песчинкой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Perante do redemoinho de pedaços de metais, {f:5:Beatrice} não era nada mais do que uma mera partícula.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 在巨大的铁锤旋风之前，贝阿朵莉切只不过是一粒豆子。

Umineko Project (UP): The instant the whirlwind started to suck {f:5:Beatrice} in, {f:5:Beatrice}'s form turned into a massive War Tower.
Steam (ST): The instant the whirlwind started to suck {f:5:Beatrice} in, she appeared to change into a massive War Tower.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The instant the whirlwind started to suck Beatrice in, Beatrice's form turned into a massive War Tower.
PC Japanese (JP): その旋風がベアトリーチェを飲み込もうとした瞬間、ベアトリーチェの姿が巨大な戦塔に変わる。
Russian (RU): Но как только вихрь стал засасывать {f:5:Беатриче}, её фигура превратилась в массивную боевую башню.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No instante em que o redemoinho começou a sugar {f:5:Beatrice}, sua forma transformou‐se em uma imensa Torre de Guerra.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 在旋風即將吞沒貝阿朵莉切的一瞬間，她的身姿變成了巨大的戰塔。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 在旋风即将吞没贝阿朵莉切的一瞬间，她的身姿变成了巨大的战塔。

Umineko Project (UP): The Iron Hammer smashed the War Tower, scattered tremendous amounts of rubble, but it did not reach she who had escaped behind it.
Steam (ST): The Iron Hammer smashed the War Tower, scattering tremendous amounts of rubble, but it did not reach she who had escaped behind it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The Iron Hammer smashed the War Tower, scattered tremendous amounts of rubble, but it did not reach she who had escaped behind it.
PC Japanese (JP): 鉄槌は戦塔を砕き、凄まじい瓦礫を撒き散らすが、その後へと逃れていた彼女には届かなかった。
Russian (RU): Железный молот врезался в боевую башню, выбив из неё огромное множество камней, но не достиг той, что пряталась за ней.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): O Martelo de Aço esmagou a Torre de Guerra, espalhando massivos destroços, mas não alcançou {f:5:Beatrice}, que conseguiu escapar se escondendo por trás.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 鐵錘雖然砸碎了戰塔，撒下無數瓦礫，但已無法再傷及逃到後面的她了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 铁锤虽然砸碎了战塔，撒下无数瓦砾，但已无法再伤及逃到后面的她了。

Umineko Project (UP): Furthermore, when the smoke started to settle, the War Tower had sucked in the massive Iron Hammer without crumbling, and blocked the way.
Steam (ST): Furthermore, when the smoke started to settle, the War Tower had sucked in the massive Iron Hammer without crumbling, and blocked the way.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Furthermore, when the smoke started to settle, the War Tower had sucked in the massive Iron Hammer without crumbling, and blocked the way.
PC Japanese (JP): しかも噴煙が収まってみると、戦塔は巨大鉄槌を飲み込んだまま崩れず立ちはだかっている。
Russian (RU): Более того, когда дым стал рассеиваться, боевая башня, всосавшая массивный Железный молот, выстояла и заблокировала путь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além disso, quando a fumaça começou a baixar, a Torre de Guerra havia engolido o gigante Martelo de Aço sem se despedaçar, bloqueando o caminho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 而且，等煙散去了後一看，戰塔保持著吞噬巨大鐵錘的狀態並未倒塌，堵住了前路。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 而且，等烟散去了后一看，战塔保持着吞噬巨大铁锤的状态并未倒塌，堵住了前路。

Umineko Project (UP): Even the giant‐smashing Iron Hammer couldn't break through the final tower protecting the witch.
Steam (ST): Even the giant-smashing Iron Hammer couldn't break through the final tower protecting the witch.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Even the giant-smashing Iron Hammer couldn't break through the final tower protecting the witch.
PC Japanese (JP): 巨人を砕く鉄槌でも、魔女を守る最後の塔は打ち砕けなかったのだ。
Russian (RU): Даже сокрушающий великанов Железный молот не смог пробиться через последнюю башню, защищающую ведьму.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nem mesmo o Martelo de Aço gigante, com todo o seu ímpeto, foi capaz de quebrar a torre final que protegia a bruxa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 就連這擊碎巨人的鐵錘，都沒能打碎守護魔女的最後戰塔。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 就连这击碎巨人的铁锤，都没能打碎守护魔女的最后战塔。

Umineko Project (UP): However, this War Tower was in fact the witch's last trump card.{n}It was a War Tower for dodging that could only save her from danger once.
Steam (ST): However, this War Tower was actually the witch's last trump card. It was a War Tower for dodging that could only save her from danger once.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, this War Tower truly was the witch's last trump card. It was a War Tower for dodging that could only save her from danger once.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、この戦塔は実は魔女の最後の切り札だった。危機をたった一度だけ救ってくれる変わり身の戦塔だったのだ。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): しかし、この戦塔は実は魔女の最後の切り札だった。{n}危機をたった一度だけ救ってくれる変わり身の戦塔だったのだ。
Russian (RU): Однако та боевая башня действительно была козырной картой ведьмы.{n}Она была призвана спасти её от опасности, но лишь один раз.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, aquela Torre de Guerra era, de fato, a última carta da bruxa.{n}Era uma Torre de Guerra para se esquivar que poderia salvá‐la do perigo apenas uma vez.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 不過，這戰塔其實是魔女最後的王牌。{n}是只能在千鈞一髮中救她一次的替身戰塔。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 不过，这战塔其实是魔女最后的王牌。{n}是只能在千钧一发中救她一次的替身战塔。

Umineko Project (UP): But this tower was impregnable. No weapon could break through it.
Steam (ST): But this tower was impregnable. No weapon could break through it.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): But this tower was impregnable. No weapon could break through it.
PC Japanese (JP): でも、この塔は鉄壁。如何なる武器でも打ち砕けない。
Russian (RU): Эта башня была непробиваемая. Её не могло пробить никакое орудие.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas aquela Torre de Guerra era inexpugnável. Nenhuma arma era capaz de quebrá‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，此塔銅牆鐵壁。任何武器都無法將之擊碎。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，此塔铜墙铁壁。任何武器都无法将之击碎。

Umineko Project (UP): Just then, the moon disappeared. As {f:5:Beatrice} hid in the shadows of the Giant Soldier Battle Line and the War Tower, she looked up at the sky.
Steam (ST): At that time, the moon disappeared. As {f:5:Beatrice} hid in the shadows of the Giant Soldier Battle Line and the War Tower, she looked up at the sky.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At that time, the moon disappeared. As Beatrice hid in the shadows of the Giant Soldier Battle Line and the War Tower, she looked up at the sky.
PC Japanese (JP): その時、月が消えた。ベアトリーチェは、巨人兵たちの戦列と戦塔の影に潜みながら、空を見上げる。
Russian (RU): В это время луна исчезла. Спрятавшаяся в тени боевого строя солдат‐великанов и боевой башни {f:5:Беатриче} взглянула на небо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele instante, a Lua desapareceu. {f:5:Beatrice} escondeu‐se nas sombra dos Soldados Gigantes de Linha de Batalha e da Torre de Guerra, e olhou para o céu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 此時，月亮消失了。貝阿朵莉切躲在巨人兵戰列與戰塔的影子中，抬頭望向天空。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 此时，月亮消失了。贝阿朵莉切躲在巨人兵战列与战塔的影子中，抬头望向天空。

Umineko Project (UP): When she did, inside the moon was the figure of a massive horse ridden by the god of war and death.
Steam (ST): When she did, inside the moon was the figure of a massive horse ridden by the god of war and death.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When she did, inside the moon was the figure of a massive horse ridden by the god of war and death.
PC Japanese (JP): すると月の中に、巨大な馬とそれにまたがる戦と死の神の姿が。
Russian (RU): Там, в луне, она увидела фигуру громадного коня, на котором ехал бог войны и смерти.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ao fazer isto, dentro da Lua havia a figura de um imenso cavalo galopado pelo deus da guerra e da morte.

Umineko Project (UP): "Certainly. Tonight's first twilight became a little too riotous. It will require some cleaning up. It shall be handled immediately. Goats, it is time to clean up."

Umineko Project (UP): When Ronove snapped his fingers, blazing, sparkling eyes began to blink open in the shadows and darkness, becoming goat‐headed attendants, which appeared one after another, slowly out of the black.
